review.title: Overpriced.
review.reviewText: This hotel talks about their "amenities" & yet there were almost none. No coffee maker in the room, no room service & a wine hour that lasts exactly that- 1 hour from 5-6. The location was ok though right on the edge of the Tenderloin. Though the room was small it was comfortable & quiet: but for a high rate a night I expect a bit more. Would not book again.
review.negativeRemarks: The attached restaurant's food was very average: if you're going to steer people towards a restaurant please improve the food.

review.title: Great Hotwl in a Wonderdul location.
review.reviewText: From the minute we walked through the front door we had an excellent experience. Friendly staff who bumped is to a suite! Beautiful, clean, and quite room. Such a great way to spend the night in San Fran.

review.title: Good place
review.reviewText: Great hotel great location! It was clean and quite and comfortable. I will be returning here soon! And I have to add more words to submit my review even though I have nothing else to say. I only stayed one night and it was good. Why do I have to write so much about my stay just to submit a review. If it doesn't go through this time I won't be submitting my feedback. This is stupid

review.title: Close to Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Good location for hotel. Has some style about the building. Very nice fireplaces in public areas.  

Rooms are nicely decorated not bland corporate rooms.
Good location, clean and updated rooms. They acknowledged my Expedia VIP status as well

review.title: Excellent boutique
review.reviewText:
The Marker is an excellent boutique hotel that's a 2 minute walk from union square.  The rooms are clean, well decorated, and the beds and pillows are extremely comfortable. 
As a bonus, they have free lemon flavored ice water all day which is great to grab on your way out to tour the city.
There is a 22 dollar a night amenities fee which I think should just be calculated into the hotel price to avoid mislead costumers. It does, however, include bikes rentals (great to tour the local area), coffee and tea until 10 am and wine hour from 5-6. 
In terms of improvement, the amenities fee should cover a light breakfast to go with the coffee and tea, or at the very least some pastries. Similarly, the wine hour should be pushed off an hour since many people are still out and about from 5-6.
Other than that, great hotel which I would definitely return to.

review.title: Nice hotel but location is sketchy.
review.reviewText: We arrived and the staff was very attentive. The one issue was that it took a while to get our luggage upstairs and they wouldn't let us take it ourselves.

review.title: Great location with great decor!
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is fantastic and the hotel itself is very pretty and well-maintained. The room was small, but otherwise comfortable. My only complaint was with the bed itself, which was hard as a rock. Luckily, we were only staying one night, or I would have had no sleep on this trip.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel and the staff are great the area is on a block where alot of people beg for money. the security at the hotel make sure to keep thr pan handlers away from the hotel. room was great pillows could be better though

review.title: Nice hotel close to most attractions
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is rather nice, I struggled with the switches in the room as they are not conventional and there aren't any centralised switches. Asked for help at the front desk after a12 hours flight and had to wait in the dark for 30 minutes until I figured out myself on how to switch on the three different lamps. Help came far too late. Internet and other services aren't free but we get charged on a daily basis for Internet, morning coffee, evening wine and gym access weather you use it or not.
review.positiveRemarks: It is in a convenient location, rooms are quiet and bedding is really comfy
review.negativeRemarks: Centralised switches and Internet free of extra charge. Scrap the wine, phone calls and gym access charges as no every one uses such services.
review.locationRemarks: Very touristy spot. Powell station great for commuting in and out of town. Cable are cars right there  as the shopping malls and cheap food places.

review.reviewText: second floor noisy, staff inexperience, food slow, updating only superfiicial
The room was super small but the location was fantastic and amazing staff.

review.title: Room as pictured.
review.reviewText: The room was nice and cozy. Looks as pictured on the website. The location was ideal for us. Overall great stay and would stay there again, although, it is a bit pricey.
review.positiveRemarks: The room colors and decor were fab.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Right down the street from Masonic center and a convenient Starbucks downstairs across the street.

review.title: Staying at The Marker in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Staff were very accommodating.  Taxis were easily available with the help of the porters, if needed.  Tratto Restaurant good value. Enjoyed the 5-6 pm free wine tastings every afternoon.  Got excellent service at the Front Desk.

I have stayed at the Marker in the past and was incredibly impressed with everything about it. Thinking it would be the same great experience, I returned. I understand it has changed ownership twice in the year since my last visit. The new owners have missed the mark. Understaffed, lack of personalization for the most part. James at the bell desk/valet and the night security guard were the only staff that even acknowledged the guests.

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: When you spend this much you would at least expect tea and coffee in your room...had to go downstairs to get it! Apparently it recently had a name change...possibly because it is nowhere near a 4 star.....our suite was nice though and it was only 2 blocks from union square...great shopping location.

review.title: Wonderful Experience and Close to Everything!
review.reviewText:
Spent two nights at the The Marker on a family trip to the city.  We had a great experience from the moment we stepped out of our car.  From the Valet to the folks at the front desk, not only was the service perfect, they made it personal and fun!  For example, the manager spent time going through the "Treasure Chest" with my son to find the perfect toy for him to enjoy during his stay.  In addition, he also took the time to share with us a lot about the city. 

Our room was in perfect condition.  Beautiful, clean furnishings and it was very quiet for a city hotel.  I will certainly stay at this location again.  It truly is a very good location to get to a variety of places in the city on foot or by public transport.  Plus the other folks staying that we met were also very friendly and hip which also makes it fun.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Hip Hotel Style, Good Value for Services and Room Quality
review.negativeRemarks: I think they should consider improving the flow of the lobby.  They have a great space, but it doesn't draw you in as it could.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square Shopping and Catch a cable car to the wharf.

review.title: Lacks Attention to Detail
review.reviewText: Our room and bedding was comfortable and clean and they have obviously gone to some effort to update the hotel. Unfortunately, the TV, fridge, phone and table lamp did not work (a loose plug issue); it took two trips to the front desk before it was mostly fixed but never quite got there. Another reviewer pointed out the channel selection on the TV leaves a bit to be desired. Much is made of their "amenities", for which they shamelessly propose to charge an additional $20/day - for internet (which appears in several places on the Expedia webpage as "free", so read the fine print), bicycles (in hilly SF? um, ok...), telephone calls (people use their cell phones) and a few other "standards" in other hotels like a fitness room. The wine hour was a nice touch, but fairly common in SF: it is whisked away promptly at 6 pm, 6:01 is too late, so sorry. The morning coffee was tepid. To their credit, the front desk agreed to waive the charge when I pointed these things out to them. I think they are trying hard, but need to up their game on the small things, much less charge people extra for them.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location. Comfortable beds and linens.

review.title: One of the worst experience
review.reviewText: This is my first review ever.  I usually don't leave reviews but this hotel stay was the worst.  This is a highly priced hotel, obviously your expectations are a little high.  Pillows are so terrible.  Even two pillow will make you feel like you are laying on the floor.  The bed it self is so old.  When you turn you can actually hear the springs.  This is just the start.  We finally managed to sleep around 1:00 AM.  At 2:30 AM Fire Alarm went off.  The whole seventh floor was suppose to be evacuated but not a single staff member were to be found on seventh floor.  When all of us managed to make it downstairs to Main lobby, No one knew what was going on except one person at front desk.  We waited in the lobby for almost an hour just to find out that it was false alarm.  If this is a high class hotel, then what is security doing?  Some one pulled the fire alarm and ran with out the security catching them?  After all of that drama, right at 9:00 AM, room cleaning staff kept knocking on my door.  Even though the check out time is not until 12 noon.  She knocked for good 3 minutes until I finally woke and managed to open the door and tell her that we are not checking out until 12 noon.  Did not sleep that night.  When checking out and told the person that I had a terrible experience at this hotel,  He said "I am sorry, we will just refund your emanity fees"  Which is 3% compare to what I  paid for the hotel.  This was really bad experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed, pillows, Not disturbing guests while their stay

review.title: Too much money for tiny rooms and outdated decor
review.reviewText: Really did not like this hotel. Staff was nice, but room was so small, did not feel entirely clean, and the colors and decor were kind of dated (very 80s euro). Oh, and the free coffee was awful! Really bad coffee.

review.title: Happy Birthday to my husband
review.reviewText: I wanted something a bit special for his 60th Birthday.  Although the hotel did not do any thing special.  The room was wonderful we enjoyed the spa and the restaurant was exceptional!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, roomy, loved the decor, easy Ck in and out Exceptional Resturant
review.negativeRemarks: No coffee in the room and no room service.
review.locationRemarks: Well it's SFO so the sky is the limit!!!

review.title: Very cute hotel!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a great spot and walking distance to almost anywhere.  The hotel staff were very pleasant, the room was clean and quite.
review.locationRemarks: We walked everywhere....very convenient.

review.reviewText: Most friendly professional helpful staff ever!! Rooms very clean although they are smaller than I had thought. Would deff recommend and would stay here again!!

review.title: Great Hotel in Union Square Area
review.reviewText:
Hotel has excellent amenities with a wine hour and bicycles available for exploring San Francisco.  The rooms were quiet, but the hotel had plenty of energy with a very courteous staff.

The bath tub was a little dated, but the furniture and decor were stylish and practical for today's traveler.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Carlos,

Thank you for taking the time to review The Marker Hotel. I'm happy to hear that you had a great time while staying with us in San Francisco. We look forward to welcoming you back to the city. Please don't hesitate to reach out directly for anything you may need in the future. 

Best,
Clayton
Director of Guest Experience

review.title: Nice hotel near the unión square
review.reviewText: San Francisco is a beautiful city, downtown, chinatown, pear 39!!!!! Excelent place for vacation!

review.title: Trying to be upscale but falls short
review.reviewText:
The Marker is trying to be a cool, chic, trendy hotel.  And in some ways, it does so but falls down on the details.  For such an expensive hotel, they need to get the basics right.  First, we had a "premium" queen room.  I fail to see what was premium about it.  The bed was clearly smaller than a Queen and snug for two people.  The bathroom lacked flash and was just ok (old school bathtub with shower curtain and small).  No private toilet here so be ready to be intimate with your roommate.  Small details like electrical plates broken or not attached (cheap and ugly) were not attended to.  The room was small and our view was the wall of the building next door.  The television service was scant featuring some 15 channels.  Not much to brag about.
On the bright side, the staff was friendly.  Happy hour complimentary wine was served downstairs each evening and coffee in the morning.  Not a bad place, but not up to the standard of a modern cool hotel.  No comparison to the Parker, W, or other such hotels.  I won't stay there again.

review.title: Close to Walgreens and upscale retailers
review.reviewText: The man who checked us in did not inform us of any thing.  It's when I questioned them about the money charged to my card the other gentleman explained to us what the money was for.  The room was cute but our plumming toilet did not work.  The rug felt sticky, but the shower was wonderful. All in all I won stay there again.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is good. This is already the second time we live in. Everything is good. But only one thing is hotel amenity fee. I don't know why it charges us. We don't use anything within the hotel. I google search it and some said the wireless service is also part of it. So anyway, except this hotel amenity fee, others are all good. Good location, clean room and nice staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, clean room and nice staff.
review.locationRemarks: It really closes to Union Square. Walking from hotel to union square costs 5 mins (it only 4-5 blocks between them).

review.title: Uncertain if I'll continue to stay here...
review.reviewText: When the hotel was a Kimpton, beds were more comfortable. The bedding has changed. Kinda tired of walking out of hotel into homeless people to get to Union Square, for the price.

review.title: Fine, but not 4 star.
review.reviewText:
Starting with the location...I was in a panic when I driver pulled up to the hotel. It was dark and there were homeless people everywhere. The hotel security came out to the car to escort us inside. The hotel itself is an older building that has been restored. Overall, a very cute place. The rooms are small with very limited storage. I had to leave the suit cases out all week because there is zero room in the closet. Drawer storage was equivalent to two night stand drawers. The bathroom itself was tiny and needs to be redone. Overall it was mainly just worn. 

While the hotel in conveniently located just two blocks from Union Sqare, it's a rough two blocks. We made sure that we were back inside before dark each night. Even during the day the walk is dirty and smells strongly of urine. In addition you will encounter many homeless individuals asking for money about every 20 feet. 

The hotel staff was friendly. We never asked for much to really rate their quality. The $30 amenity fee was a joke. Really you are paying $30 for wireless access and flavored water in the lobby. There is a restaurant and bar attached to the hotel, but it was open limited hours. The drinks that we had from there were fine, but we didn't feel that the menu had many options. The Walgreens across the street was the closest thing that we had to room service. 

I would not recommend this hotel for people with children, or anyone not completely accustom to city life.

review.title: Loved the hotel outlook has character.
review.reviewText: Loved the hotels classic look. Only downside to our stay is our room was a bit warm no air con in the rooms which we found really strange for the price you pay.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything in midtown
review.reviewText: Nice small boutique hotel in union square. Clean, room is kinda small but was alright for the 2 nights we stayed. Service was ok too!

review.title: quality hotel but...
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is nice and our room was freshly updated with nice features. The staff were friendly aswel. What I wasn't expecting was although I had paid for the room in full for 7 nights  ($2000 aud) they slugged me a nightly deposit and amenity fee that came to $1300 aud (7 nights) deducted from my credit card on checkin. This end of geary street also had heaps of homeless hanging around constantly begging.
I enjoyed the location of the hotel :) It was in a nice location of San Francisco

review.title: Well maintained, modern, central hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was extremely friendly & helpful. The bed was super comfortable and our bedroom was extremely clean and well decorated. No complaints!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is well decorated and smelt wonderful when you first walked inside. They also host a wine hour in the late afternoon.

review.title: A very nice stay in a boutique. But...
review.reviewText: My stay here was short and nice. My only issues were parking ( it's $58.00 a night), I asked for A roll out bed ( which was $30), and the pillow decorations were filthy ( why would you consistently reuse Dirty pillows on a clean bed?). On a better note,  The hotel was very artistic and beautiful and The staff were very polite.

review.title: Nice Hotel Hidden Cost!
review.reviewText: Hotel was awesome and in great location. When I get the final bill I get charged $38/day resort fee and $58/night valet parking. It would be nice to just add the resort fee to the cost of the room instead of hiding the charge and then telling you about it during check out. Overall very nice hotel. Staff was awesome and BDK restaurant was the best!

review.title: Central Hotel Worth the Price
review.reviewText:
Loved my stay at the Marker! It was a classy place that is less than a 8 min walk to Union Square, and is very close to transportation as well! 

Location: The location is convenient in other ways, too--right across the street is a Walgreens if you forgot anything (although the staff can provide most toiletries), or if you get sick from the chilly SF weather, or if you just want some cheaper snacks. Great restaurants are nearby as well, and I have to say that the restaurant downstairs is quite nice too.

Staff/Service: Really friendly and helpful staff--they got us hooked up with some tours (that usually meet up in Union Square, which is close). 

Room: Decor was classy but unique! It looked amazing. The layout of the bathroom was really nice, too! Plenty of counter space for makeup or other toiletries. Also plenty of storage space if you're staying a while. Beds were comfortable, and the room overall was pretty quiet. Wifi was reliable!

Overall: worth the money! Definitely one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at.

review.title: No room service
review.reviewText: There is a good restaurant off the hotel lobby, but there is NOT room service.

review.title: good location and friendly people.
review.reviewText: The place is cute and cozy. big fire places and wine generously poured from five to six. Cozy, friendly atmosphere to drink it in. Coffee and hot chocolate available in the morning and fresh fruit infused water all day. The hotel could used some updating, but it was very clean. The room which was a junior suite was ok. It was decorated cute. Not your typical hotel but like a person might want to decorate their own room. We had three of us there so when you pulled out the coach there wasn't a lot of room to walk around it. My biggest problem with it was that the bathroom does not have a separate shower and toilet. That meant that you couldn't have one person doing their makeup or using the sink when the other was in the shower. My mothers biggest complain was that their was no coffee available in the room. So if you are used to having a cup of coffee before you get dressed  no luck. You have to walk downstairs to get it.
review.positiveRemarks: the people were great--super friendly and helpful. thanks Jackson and everyone else. The location was within a 10 minute walk to he best shopping
review.negativeRemarks: Separate toilet and shower area. Coffee pot in the room.
review.locationRemarks: The location was with in a 10 minute walk to he best shopping and restaurants available downtown. Great food and service everywhere we went.

review.title: Hospital visit
review.reviewText: My daughters and I were staying in SF, while their father was having surgery. Kyle the manager was kind enough to upgrade us to a larger room, and assisted us with all of request. Delightful and hospitable. five stars

review.title: Perfect buy for the money
review.reviewText: We stayed in double bed room. It was clean, roomy, neat, staff was very nice.

review.title: Other than the resort fee everything was great
review.reviewText: Other than the resort fee everything was great. Resort fee should be included in the Expedia rate to show a truer cost per night.

review.title: Cute Hotel!
review.reviewText: Close to everything, except overnight parking was $58.00 per day, also the resort fee of $34.00 per day was super high the amenities we paid for we did not use.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds were uncomfortable.  Replace bedding.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything, 2 blocks from union square and cable carts.  Taxicab ride to Pier 39 and fishermans wharft about $12.00.  Love the location.

review.title: Great boutique hotel, but expensive fees
review.reviewText: We got a great deal for the hotel, beautiful facility, and the staff was great! What I wasn't prepared for was paying $69 for parking my car overnight and a $30 "amenities fee!!" My great deal for the hotel went out the window.

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: Close to many attractions. Friendly staff. Older hotel but has been updated.
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located. Reasonably priced for the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee pots in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping and restaurants. Within walking distance to many attractions.

review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and accomodating. They have a service where you can check your bags even after you check out so you can explore the city before your flight (if you have a late flight). Overall, the room was nice and I'd definitely stay here again.

review.title: Prepare to be attended to!
review.reviewText:
Wow. . . What a pleasant surprise The Marker Hotel is. . . . we have our favorite Kimpton - boutique style hotel that we stay in while visiting SF however, since the name & mgmt changed, we decided to try something new.  The customer service from the front desk clerks is outstanding!! I contacted them prior to our arrival for current dining recommendations and Eddy took the time to speak to me in detail - there was no rush and he followed through with an email with a list of the staff suggestions.  Upon check in, Wesley went beyond the call of duty to show us rooms that we could upgrade to. .  but honestly, the standard double bed room was so sufficient and comfortable, an upgrade was not really necessary.  The hotel is gorgeous, clean and all employees including front doorman and housekeeping are extremely nice and accommodating.  

Our beds were comfortable, clean and we had a good nights sleep - I read some other negative remarks regarding the "cleanliness" of the rooms - but we had no issue at all - during our visit - this hotel is spotless and in fact my sister commented on the lovely fragrance in their grand living room - where we toasted SF at the hotel's wine hour.  
The only "slightly" negative experience is when we stopped by twice to speak with Front Desk Manager to commend him about his associates & he couldn't take a second to come out and speak with us. But besides that, Fabulous! - we can't rave enough about The Marker and can't wait to return!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, customer service, rooms, decor, comfort
review.negativeRemarks: the wine served at wine hour
review.locationRemarks: lots of shopping, restaurants - great location

review.title: Great hotel in good location
review.reviewText:
This place looks exactly like on the photographs. It is clean and nicely decorated. It is very conveniently located- close to shopping, public transportation and restraints.
Great deal.

review.title: Close to EVERYTHING!
review.reviewText: Family vacation with 2 teenagers. Room was perfect for us, though the pull out couch bed was a little springy; king bed was comfy the view was nice. Wonderful service! Enjoyed the fireplace in the lobby for hanging out with the kids.

review.title: Very nice, older hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and friendly staff. The hotel was clean but could use an updating

review.title: pattycake
review.reviewText: Great Location to many neighborhoods, close to shopping, dining and entertainment.valet parking a plus. Front desk service was exceptional always greeted us as we entered or exited the hotel, very friendly and pleasant staff.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of everything, able to walk to most destinations or a short drive to dine in other neighborhoods in the city.

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: Really nice old style hotel which has been  renovated. Easy access to everything by walking or public transit. It is also close to an area of street people so just need to be careful at night.

review.title: Great location and wonderful hotel.
review.reviewText: Great location and wonderful hotel. There was a happy hour every day from 5-6pm in the hotel lobby with complimentary wine as well as free hot coffee in the mornings, and the restaurant on the ground floor was a great and convenient option for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Only issue was there was no coffee or tea maker in the room, and the shower/tub combo in the room was a little outdated for the rest of the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful and we had a great experience overall.

review.title: Great hotel and service, hidden fees
review.reviewText: Watch out for the amenities fee, which they charge without asking or notifying in advance.

review.title: Excellent boutique hotel in San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It was comfortable and provided a unique experience you don't find at chain hotels. We were upgraded to a Jr. Suite which was very nice. The bathroom was gorgeous. Only down side was not much counter space in there. 
Definitely stay here

review.title: Nice hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay and will stay here again in the future. Staff was very kind and helpful. Room was clean and updated. Only negative was the significant number of homeless people begging for money but that was everywhere, not just outside the hotel.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel close to all the main places
review.reviewText: The wifi is amazing probably one of the best hotels we stayed at in USA

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: the hotel was within walking distance to union square; shopping, cable cars and china town restaurants. the hotel staff goes out of their way to be helpful,      see you next year.
review.negativeRemarks: remove the beggars off the streets at night they are quite thick .

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: It was a fabulous hotel. I would stay there again. It was beautiful inside and the restaurant was decent as well. Definitely  place to go to again.
Great hotel in the heart of San Francisco.  Close to everything.

review.title: Very nice & conveniently located hotel
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay in The Marker. Everything was excellent starting with check-in and finishing with check out.

review.title: Great hotel close to main attractions
review.reviewText: Clean/comfortable room. Could do with more lighting. Staff helpful. Great restaurant located within hotel.

review.title: basic hotel, nothing special
review.reviewText: extra fee not noted in price or mentioned anywhere adding up to 40 dollars per night. lame, just include this stuff in the cost.

review.title: Great value for the location and quality.
review.reviewText: I found this hotel to be a great value given the location (Union square) and what you get - a great lobby, nice rooms,etc.   I would have given it 5 stars, but for a few minor annoyances in the room - the lighting is a bit too dark, the closet small and the door doesn't close, etc.

review.title: Close to union square recent remodel looks great
review.reviewText: Got in from SFO early. Stopped by to drop the bags and explore . Front desk not only got us checked in early but offered an upgrade to a suite. Largest room I've ever stayed in this city. Only negative was the "urban fee" . Booked Thur Expedia , and was one of those fine print fees.  I think u may get your money's worth in a place like Vegas but not the coffee in the morning here.
review.negativeRemarks: Great stay
review.locationRemarks: Close to Bart

review.title: Fun hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Hotel is great, helpful and friendly staff, fun clean & tastefully decorated rooms.  Surprisingly quiet given the location downtown (we were on the 7th floor).  Restaurant was also wonderful, and we even sat next to one of SF Congresswomen!!
review.negativeRemarks: I was frustrated by an additional $35 fee charged by the hotel on top of the expedia rate.  Looking back, this was disclosed, but in the fine print

review.reviewText: The rooms were nice, a bit on the smaller size. It's clean and the decor is quite lovely.

review.title: 60$ parking and 30$ a day fee
review.reviewText: Besides paying 30$ a day and the 60$ in parking a night it was a good trip
Loved it! Our room was small, but clean & cute. Staff was nice & it was within walking distance of most of the attractions I wanted to see. I would totally stay here again.

review.title: central and convenient, but our room was small
review.reviewText: as a stop over for a couple of nights, that worked for us, but we would have preferred more space and a view that was not over other rooms and a lot of pipes. The blinds did not hold open, the water was cold the morning we got up early to leave, the staff were sometimes helpful and sometimes just 'doing their job'.
review.positiveRemarks: It is central for San Francisco and you can walk easily to Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe another room would be better?
review.locationRemarks: Central for SF - shopping, eating, sight seeing.

review.title: Customer service GREAT! Loved the decor
review.reviewText: Loved the decor, the location, the staff was super helpful and I enjoyed the 5pm happy hour. thumbs up!
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the decor, the location, the staff was super helpful and I enjoyed the 5pm happy hour. thumbs up!
review.negativeRemarks: Only thing was ice machine was broken on my floor but not a big deal
review.locationRemarks: Walked to nearby Chinatown and got Reflexology foot massages and visited the Fortune Cookie Factory.  It was easy to uber everywhere from The Marker!

review.reviewText: Above expectations. I'll stay her every time we are visiting Sf. It was much husband's 50th birthday celebration and the upgraded is to a spa suite. Everyone was sweet and world class.

review.title: Lots of drawbacks
review.reviewText: Good location but that's about it. No room service, very uncomfortable bed and linens, low water pressure that took a very long time to heat up, no robes, and unsatisfactory customer service. This boutique hotel is just for show--not comfort or service.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.

review.reviewText:
Overall a nice, convenient hotel.  The happy hour was a nice touch.

We'd prefer a coffee maker in the room rather than trudging to the lobby for the few hours in the morning when it's available.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect from the start. We arrived at around 6 AM on a Sunday morning and the man at the concierge desk was warm and kind. He told us our room was ready and he upgraded us to a junior suite! It included a king size bed and a lovely sitting area. Not a tiny room at all.
review.positiveRemarks: Asthetics, location, hotel restaurant and workout room!
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness. I noticed (what appeared to be) food stains on the drapes. I also didn't like the accumulation of dust on the end table.
review.locationRemarks: Walgreens is across the street so it's a convincing place to buy water jugs and necessities. Great location for shopping and dining.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Small hotel with extremely helpful and nice staff. I reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in Union Square area.

I was looking for a clean, decently rated and (relatively) cheap place to stay for a conference happening near Union Square, and this hotel provided that. My overall experience was pretty good. It's still pricey, but that's the case with everything in San Francisco, and at the time I booked it this hotel had a better deal than similar ones in the area. I had no issues with the staff. My room (1 queen bed) seemed a bit small, but that wasn't a problem for a solo traveller. The room was aesthetic, very clean, came with a mini-fridge and a safe, and the bed was comfortable. However it was pretty easy to hear people in the halls and adjacent rooms. The free wi-fi worked well, but I would have preferred a secure, password-protected connection to an open one. Should you need to make changes to your reservation, it's possible to get a refund as long as you notify them 48 hours in advance; I had no problem getting my money back when I needed to cancel my last night. Regarding breakfast, I never had it at this hotel so I can't speak for the food, but for those interested, it is served in the adjacent BDK restaurant and is not free. Finally, this hotel does not have a shuttle service to and from the airport, but it is a few blocks away from the BART station.
review.positiveRemarks: I appreciated the clean, aesthetic room, the decent amenities, the free wi-fi, and the refund policy.
review.negativeRemarks: A secure wi-fi connection would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: There are some decent places to eat in the area. Just be aware that you're very likely to come across a few panhandlers.

review.reviewText: Have stayed there dozens of times, as my daughter lived nearby. This is the first time since the hotel has been under new management. With the exception of the reliable fine dining the restaurant in the previous incarnation of the hotel provided, the new management has kept the spirit of the previous management. When they stop doing that we will stop staying there. The new restaurant is not a fine dining establishment.  The new function space created by the restaurant redesign does not have the stately qualities of the older parts of the hotel, but I just got a peek at it, but they were setting up for a wedding…The interesting, comfortable guest rooms are the same, and It's a really lovely place to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Great location, very comfortable
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a 3 nights while visiting SanFran. Rooms aren't huge, but clean, well maintained, with newer amenities. The cleaning staff is great, and my room always had a fresh supply of towels and other toiletries. The room was clean, the bedding super comfortable and also had a spacious closet. They also had a morning coffee bar and evening wine reception, which was nice. The staff at the front desk was also pretty helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: I think the walls are pretty thin. I could hear some off banging on the walls from the room adjacent to mine at 2 am! Also, poor cell phone reception!
review.locationRemarks: Couple of blocks from Union Square. Shops, restaurants, coffee places all easily accessible. It's a short walk from Chinatown, North Beach and Mission

review.title: The bed pillows were worn out
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was friendly. It needs more room in the hotel room. There was no view for the price paid.
Right in Union Square. Quiet hotel, Was able to sleep at night.

review.title: Small Hotel
review.reviewText: Room was very small.  Nice lobby area. And wine tasting at 5 is a plus
review.locationRemarks: A little off the main drag

review.reviewText: Wonderful stay! The hotel bikes were an added bonus, as was the complimentary wine each evening, coffee & tea in the morning & fruit water all day long.

review.title: smaller than expected- view was terrible
review.reviewText: nice hotel but way smaller than expected- no place to sit- one small chair- workout facility was great-
review.negativeRemarks: not sure- small rooms
review.locationRemarks: Union Square- nice area- spent most of the trip at the Wharf- will stay there next time

review.reviewText: The hotel experience was wonderful. It is in a good, center area. It is easy to go everywhere. The staff was extremely helpful and very attentive. Overall, it was a wonderful exprecience. A hotel worth going back in a next visit.

review.title: Loved all but the bed
review.reviewText: Clean room and great staff and close to union square this hotel was everything I wanted, however the bed was a little too firm, and the pillows were too flat. other than the bed not being to my personal preference, I loved everything else.

review.title: nice hotel at downtown
review.reviewText:
the room is small, but decorated with good styles. 
staff are nice, but it might be helpful if can increase the receptions a little bit, since sometimes the customers lined up.
very convenient for walk around the city.

review.title: Ok choice for dogs
review.reviewText: Ok choice in the heart of San Fran if you have dogs with you.  The staff was tolerant of the dogs, not really welcoming though.  The neighborhood is hard for walking dogs, no real grass around, but it is just the way it is in this part of the city.  Was not overly impressed with room or hotel, just ok.  Would probably pick another place in the future.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Spent a week in early November, very nice hotel which is going thru changes in management yet we didnt notice it and had a pleasant time there.

The hotel could improve on the use of their space as they had a great loby which was not used at all.

Other than that, it is in a good location and close to public transport which is most of what you will need to explore the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve on the use of their space as they had a great loby which was not used at all. Charging $60 for parking when there is a $25 less than 1 block.

review.title: Chic hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: I stayed here with coworkers for a conference at nearby Hilton.  We had a corner room so it was very quiet (even though it was close to the elevators).  Our beds were very comfortable and the cleaning ladies were excellent in making up our rooms and making sure we were always stocked up with shampoo/conditioner/soap.  The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful with restaurant recommendations and attending to all our needs/questions.  We took the airport transfer offered by the hotel and our driver was absolutely wonderful!  Definitely would stay again and highly recommend to everyone :)
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel offered complimentary bikes but every morning, they were already reserved by other guests (even though we were told they cannot be reserved)
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square and shopping.  Lots of restaurants on Geary Street!

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: We visited the Marker for our honeymoon in October. Our entire experience was wonderful! I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend to others. Wesley at the front desk was very friendly and helpful as soon as we walked in the door. We checked in late on Sunday evening and received a complimentary upgrade to a suite after mentioning we were on our honeymoon. The front desk also sent up a bottle of champagne with a card the following day. This was one of my first experiences staying in a smaller, boutique type hotel. I really enjoyed walking in and recognizing the staff each day. We also took advantage of the complimentary wine reception in the lobby in the evenings from 5-6. It was nice to stop by and grab a drink before we went out for dinner in the evenings! We used the front desk several times for restaurant recommendations and to schedule a Napa Valley wine tour. The location is very convenient to Union Square. Cable cars, MUNI, and various tour groups are within a 2 block walk. There is a Walgreens directly across from the hotel in case you forget any essentials. I felt safe walking to and from the hotel to nearby restaurants and shopping around Union Square. As first time visitors, we enjoyed taking a double decker tour bus around town and also utilized a 7 day pass for the cable cars and MUNI, which were all very convenient to the hotel. Overall, I was very satisfied with our stay and would highly recommend the Marker!
review.positiveRemarks: I appreciated the friendly staff, the convenient location, and the cleanliness of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of any issues during our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Just look around Union Square- cable cars, mix of upscale and reasonably priced shopping opportunities, and a great variety of food choices!

review.title: Great hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: We stayed for 4 nights and was pleased with everything the hotel had to offer.  Staff was very accommodating and friendly.  The hotel had free WiFi and complimentary coffee every morning and wine every evening.   We will definitely be back!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff is very helpful, Rooms were clean and comfortable!
review.negativeRemarks: none!
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping - Macy's, Saks & Westfield Mall.  A few blocks from Powell where all the Street cars run. Lots of restaurants close by.

review.title: San Francisco class
review.reviewText: Quick check in with beautiful, clean surroundings!! Staff helpful, friendly and professional! If we could only open the windows in the room it would've been rated a 5. Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: nice hotel, right in the heart of the city,
review.reviewText: Great location, Union Square, right in the heart of the city, only 5 blocks from China town and maybe a mile and a half from Fisherman's Wharf. Plenty of stores, resturants and clubs.

review.title: Excellent location.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very accommodating and knowledgeable about tourist attractions, transportation, restaurants etc. Most importantly they very nice and personable. If you like eclectic decor this hotel is for you.
review.negativeRemarks: The type of flooring in the enter-way. The area rug was a bit soiled.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent! Great proximity to shopping, public transportation, restaurants all within walking distant.

review.title: Isaac and Jackson "The Dream Team!"
review.reviewText: Isaac and Jackson made my stay the best I've ever had in San Francisco! They went above and beyond with their expertise in customer service. No room service- per se- However the restaurant and bar there are beyond delectable! As a whole the hotel gets nothing but 10s from me!

review.title: Amazing accommodations!
review.reviewText: They were able to check us in early and since my husband called ahead to tell them we were celebrating our anniversary, they gave us a free upgrade to their biggest suite and had a hand written "Happy Anniversary" card along with champagne, chocolates, fortune cookies and a souvenir when we entered our room. It was an unforgettable experience and all of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel. Wonderfully helpful staff.
review.reviewText: We stay there after a trip to Napa. It was very conveniently located we got great advice from the hotel staff about which restaurants to eat at it was a good experience.

review.title: General areas lovely but rooms expensive for what
review.reviewText:
The general impression of the hotel is good and the reception, lounge and restaurant areas are elegant. General maintenance and cleanliness is excellent. We stayed 4 nights and found certain issues with the room very irritating. 

Water pressure in the shower was very low so made washing conditioner out of one's hair a huge problem. The room had 2 double beds squeezed in, resulting in only a bedside table on one side. This is very inconvenient to the person sleeping on the side with no table. TV is placed on the desk/dressing table with obstructed view - would make sense to have it higher on the wall.

Although reception staff are friendly, they were not overeager to assist with special requests.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location close to Union Square. Complimentary Wine Tasting
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure in shower. Tv higher on a wall bracket. Bedside table on both sides of the bed.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and all major shops eg Macy's & Saks. Tram lines nearby and China Town an easy walk.

review.reviewText: Very good location, a few blocks from market street also union square I definitely recommend it

review.title: Excellent Property - Well situated
review.reviewText:
Overall quality and experience of the property was excellent.  We stayed a week.

We had a particular negative experience with one employee (day of arrival), which when brought to the attention of management they immediately rectified it to our satisfaction.

In room wifi included was a plus.
review.negativeRemarks:
Room Service - They don't have it.
Car Parking - No Fee would make it more competitive and easier to "use".
review.locationRemarks: You are very close to union square, shopping, restaurants, clubs, bars, etc... walking / uber very functional.  Local hertz was extremely inefficient.

review.title: Modern Elegance
review.reviewText: Decor was modern and the hotel was elegant without being stuffy. The rooms were spotless and the beds comfortable. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We liked the wine hour they offer every day between 5 and 6. We would undoubtedly stay there again.

review.title: A great find
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Great location, very clean with modern room decor. Restaurant and bar in hotel good for food and drink.

Great hotel at a great location. Area is a bit touristic but central to get anywhere easily. 
Rooms are comfortable and cute. Expect no views though.

review.title: beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was amazing.  Rooms were cozy and comfortable in the middle of downtown and close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothung
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants and sightseeing with cable cars nearby

review.title: Awesome location
review.reviewText: Great location centrally located near Union Square. Super friendly staff - with excellent restaurant recommendations (every place they recommended was awesome).

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: Central location to shops, restaurants and sightseeing.

review.title: Na
review.reviewText: Great hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Parking is the only pricey part of the stay

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel, clean rooms, great location, friendly and helpful staff, free wifi, free wine at 5pm, free coffee in the morning. Parking across the street (or valet) for 25.- overnight on weekdays, 30.- on weekends.

review.title: VERY PLEASED! Great hotel, good area, great beds.
review.reviewText: We loved our hotel. We upgraded to a King bed and loved every minute of it. Rooms were clean. Location was GOOD, not great.  As 2 women we had a few moments where we we traveling home at night and felt a little uneasy.  However, if you're shopping in the area it is perfect. The decor was great, the staff were very friendly, the elevators were fast, the rooms were VERY clean. Bathroom is ok, a little small, but perfect for what you need. The Soaps smell AMAZING. Overall, we are VERY happy we chose this hotel. The prices were right and if I could do it again I would choose this hotel again. VERY please
review.negativeRemarks: Room service.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping, close to the BART, great central location for exploring the city. Can be shady at night if you wander a little too far off path

review.title: Needed to upgrade my room
review.reviewText: The room that I bought thru Expedia was so tiny and looked over the roof ( which I guess explains the price)!  I had to spend an additional $50 per nite to upgrade out of that terrible room.  That new room was nice and very pleasant and glad we did that.  Overall the hotel was very nice and comfortable and great location, walking distance to many areas.    I probably won't buy a room again from Expedia

review.title: Nice hotel but I opted not to stay again.
review.reviewText: I paid for a spa room which was huge and the spa tub did work. I have to say, though, that while I slept like a log a small thing disappointed me and made me feel like a second class guest. The coffee table in the room was in horrible shape - beat up and incongruent with the decor. Sounds trivial, but I ended up not booking there for a second weekend.

review.title: Very bad room standard
review.reviewText: It's a 4* hotel but the room standard is very bad, probably 2*. Room was very small, no view at all, no free tea/coffee/water. Very disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: Room standard is very bad for a 4* hotel
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shopping mall, financial district

review.title: Very friendly and helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience at the Marker.  Nice rooms.  Beautiful hotel.  Excellent valet, bell boy, and front desk staff. Would definitely recommend to family and friends and stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Too expensive for the overnight valet fee.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, close to most everything.

review.reviewText: Good, recently updated hotel. Good location; enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Staff
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was awesome.  They were very kind and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel close to unión square
review.reviewText: Had some problems with my room and they were quickly taken care of, asked for another room and was moved but not the same typy of room, I was moved to a larger room but had no view at all.  I was sent a bottle of wine for my troubles which was a nice detail on their part.  The BDK is really good, nice bar staff and good vibe.  Overall a good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: a Little more attention to details.
review.locationRemarks: unión square, shopping, restaurants, bars

review.title: Elegant but Dirty
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel thru Expedia based on the high rating (4 stars). When my 3 children and I arrived at the hotel about 430pm,  the staffs were attentive and welcoming. We were checked in by the shift supervisor Elias?. During check in, we were told that the second room that we had reserved was not ready. Mind you this was 430pm and earliest check ins were at 3pm. Elias apologizes from the inconvenience and called housekeeping to get the room ready while we wait in the next room that was ready and assured us that someone will bring us the key pads once the room was ready. So, we went up to one of the room to unpack. When arriving at our room, it looked clean and nicely staged (just like on their website). As my daughters began to unpack, they noticed lipstick or blood stains on the bed sheets. This caused us to really take a closer look at both the two rooms. What we found were stains on three bedding sets, two pillow cases, and four comforters. We had house keeping changed out everything three times before we could get clean ones. I went down to front desk and expressed my disappointment with the cleanliness and the shift supervisor made apologies but couldn't do anything except wait to talk to his hotel manager who won't be in until the next day. As a hotel, no matter what star ratings it is, the cleanliness of the rooms, floors, and lobbies should be a priority just as well as their hospitality. This hotel should be a 2.5 to 3 star instead of a 4 star.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location of it cause it's close to ALL the shopping and bars. Walking distant to Union Square, China town and the Embarcadero.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of the rooms. Get rip of ALL the old bedding sets, Comforters. Pillow cases. Management needs to do thorough checks prior to renting out.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good and many things to do within walking distance. Stay on the East side of hotel cause West of hotel is not a good area to be in.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Love the location and happy to see the restaurant open again. Surprised to see new name and owners. Disappointed with increase for parking.lo
Good for location, shopping, trams and downtown. Lot's of down and outs. Very helpful reception staff. No hot drink making facilities.

review.title: Convenient, clean, fresh
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. Close to the action, but not in a busy area. The decor was adorable.

review.title: comfortable hotel in  a great location.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our  stay at Hotel Monaco and would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks:
room was very clean although  a little small however the bathroom was enormous!
enjoyed wine hour by the fire!
review.negativeRemarks:
the lattes we ordered at breakfast one morning were undrinkable.
the strangest coffee we have ever had!
review.locationRemarks: fabulous location .  very near  union square and the market street trolley buses.

review.title: Great hotel close to the main shopping area
review.reviewText: Close to trolley cars, shops and restaurants, but be prepared for large number of homeless people - not hotel fault just a San Francisco thing.  Helpful staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Great size comfortable room for 4 people. Beautifully decorated.
review.locationRemarks: Close to central shopping area.

review.reviewText: lovely hotel, good location.  Great restaurant in the lobby.  Free wine reception daily!

review.title: Friendly and helpful staff, clean environment
review.reviewText: Staff was always helpful with excellent suggestions and service. The room and hotel surroundings were clean and well appointed. Fast and large elevators. Within walking distance of restaurants and some chains such as Starbucks.
Friendly staff.  Great location to walk to union square and many really good restaurants.  Ask about the goldfish.

review.title: enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: I have been to San Francisco 5 times but this is the first time staying at this hotel. I will definitely stay again.  Friendly staff, clean rooms, centrally located
review.positiveRemarks: Located in the beat part of San Francisco in my opinion.  Clean rooms, lots of hot water, bar fridge.  Staff very accommodating...
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe a coffee maker in the room.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of the theatre district, Only about 30 minute walk to AT&T Park,  my favourite Blues and jazz clubs nearby....and plenty of restaurants I

review.title: Fabulous hotel for the price!
review.reviewText: The Hotel Monaco is fun, fresh and cozy.  Wonderful sitting rooms with fireplaces to cozy up to almost make you want to never leave the building, especially with the tasty BDK restaurant attached. A very easy place to have a nice meal at. Every meal we had was fantastic and the service was impeccable. The rooms are nicely decorated and well appointed with comfortable beds and linens. Much more character than your typical beige bland hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Fluffier pillows please!
review.locationRemarks: We like to walk and walk we did! Market District is within walking distance, so are many places to eat and even a nice bodega across the street.

review.title: No service or bellman, dusty tiny room
review.reviewText: No one to help w bags, no room service have to pick up food, dusty room but cute decor. Tiny bathroom

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: All good. Would have liked breakfast to be included

review.title: Conveniently located in town close to everything.
review.reviewText: No parking at hotel for guests. Off site parking costs $60 per night.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Rooms have a cool boutique decor, not huge but thoughtfully laid out with spacious bathrooms, the newly refurbished dining area off the lobby looked nice and on trend but was very noisy so we ate out, returned there for a late night drink before retiring, excellent bar staff. Overall very nice stay.

review.title: Lovely hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
It was a lovely experience our room was not available when we arrived mid afternoon, but quickly resolved, we were unhappy with our first room and the staff were very charming and quickly organised to have us moved to another room which was a relief after the long flight from Australia.
The front desk and porters and housekeeping staff were all charming and helpful with recommendations on local restaurants etc.
Loved the happy hour every evening although we only joined on one night it was a nice little touch that many guests seemed to enjoy.
Only minor draw back was the breakfast restaurant offering the staff were sweet but a few minor challenges i.e. had run out of tea both days we attempted to dine there so we ended up going out to a local diner which was fun, delicious and very cheap so perhaps a blessing in disguise, I am sure it was just teething issues as the restaurant has recently reopened.
review.positiveRemarks: The room, the atmosphere, the location, the staff, the "happy hour"
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing major
review.locationRemarks: Union square, shopping, cable car

review.title: Union Square Comfort
review.reviewText: My Husband and I loved our stay at the Monaco. Excellent location, The room was small but great condition, clean and comfortable. Staff is friendly and attentive. We would definitely stay again!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent Location! Union Square, Shops, Restaurants

review.title: Staff need training - poor organization
review.reviewText: At check in no hotel info provided nor any info in room. Requested walk in shower and was assured I had one but had a tub. When I went to front desk, shrugged and said full and to ask tomorrow! No room service and restaurant new and struggling, very salty food, cold coffee, expensive breakfast. On check out I noted I had used one six dollar bottle of water which I wouldn't have if they told me about the free water - they had no note of it on bill and the system wouldn't add it. Fifteen minutes later, all over six dollars, any good will was gone. Stupid.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff knowledge and customer service, restaurant

review.title: Comforting Escape in San Francisco
review.reviewText: From the moment I arrived I was greeted warmly by the staff.  My room was just lovely and not at all that standard dodgy hotel look.  The room was clean and comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel near Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Pleasure for this trip. Nice bar and mixologists. All staff very helpful. 
Great location too.

review.title: Clean, updated hotel close to Market Street
review.reviewText: We came to SF for business and pleasure and were very pleased with the accomodations.  The hotel is on the corner of Geary and Taylor and within walking distance to Market Street and Union Square.  If you don't mind a longer walk you can easily get to Chinatown and the SF Ferry Building at Pier 41.  It was a little far for us to walk to Fisherman's Wharf.  A cab from there was around $10.  There were also many shops and restaurants on Geary.  The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  Gave us restaurant recommendations when asked.  (Sent us up the block to Honey, Honey Cafe which was wonderful.)  Coffee and tea were provided in the lobby area in the morning and wine was offered in the evening.  The lobby area was very clean, updated and well maintained.  There were a couple of lounge areas with fireplaces were there always seemed to be a few people.  The room was clean and updated.  The bathroom was very clean as well and the housecleaning staff were friendly and thorough.  The neighborhood felt safe; although we learned to avoid Taylor and stay on Geary at night.  Alot more homeless and sketchy people there at that time.  Overall, we were extremely pleased and will plan to stay there again if our travels take us back to SF.

review.title: Ideally located hotel
review.reviewText: Having stayed in Kimptons in Chicago and Washington and loved them both, I pretty much knew what to expect and Monaco delivered.  Pleasant staff greet you each time you walk through reception.  The rooms have an eclectic mix of colours and decorative styles but are warming and comfortable.  The beds are wonderful. Powerful hairdryer, large in room safe and iron mean you have everything you need without needing to request. There is also a fridge in the room and you can ask for a coffee maker from reception. Free water in reception by the lifts. A Walgreens right across the street means you have acess to everything you need.  Our room looked out over Taylor St and really wasn't at all noisy in the night.  The location is perfect for Union Square about 2 mins walk, and perfect for the Powell BART station about 5 - 10 mins easy walk if you are coming from the airport. plenty of places to eat and drink in the area, with Loris Diner, Bourbon & Branch, Hakkasan, Colibri etc all within a couple of blocks.  Some reviews say that this hotel is on the border of the Tenderloin which is a less nice area, but we were more than happy to wander around, never felt unsafe and I can't believe anyone would feel uncomfortable around here.  I would say wherever you are in a big city, be streetwise. An all round lovely stay.  Highly recommended.

review.title: perfect central location
review.reviewText: We stayed here for our anniversary and felt really looked after by the staff who were really warm and welcoming.  They helped us with booking restaurants, trips etc. It was a lovely hotel, clean, modern and a great spot to walk around everywhere.  Gym was nice too (there is no steam room/ spa area anymore) Free tea and coffee in the morning and wine hour is a bonus.  BDK restaurant was ok - there are a lot better options out and about eg 'Jane' is a 5 min walk and for brunch is just amazing.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Great location! With in walking distance of about everything. You will want to take advantage of valet service,as parking is a problem. Expect $69 fee.

review.title: Weekend getaway to SF
review.reviewText: Somewhat disappointed from past Hotel Monaco visits. No water or coffee in room. Bathroom needs updating. TV isn't HD. Etc
Hotel Monaco is a lovely , a little quirky hotel. We loved the comfortable room, the decor, the wine hour and the breakfast (not included in the price).

review.title: Was ONCE Awesome...now TERRIBLE
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel around 20 times and it has been great! But this time it was terrible. It took 40 minutes to check in because they couldn't find my reservation. I used to be very impressed by the front desk, smooth service, sophisticated, but replaced by average and a bad attitude. Once I checked in, my room was nice but worn. Same with the elevators and hotel space overall. For almost $400 per night, I have higher expectations. However the huge disappointment was there was no room service and they took the coffee makers out of the rooms. They overhauled the previous restaurant and replaced it with a menu that was underwhelming to say the least. As a business traveler, this was a big negative. They gave me a list of restaurants that deliver but the ordering process so complicated I punted. I went to the grocery store across the street to buy a sandwich, but didn't as they looked expired. I eventually caved at ate the restaurant, hoping for the best but was again disappointed. The server was AMAZING, but the place loud, food sub par and very expensive. lastly the cost to valet park your car overnight was over $50, yowzah.  I highly doubt I'll be staying there again. My advice, for the money, go somewhere else. Not worth it.
review.positiveRemarks: The $10 credit to the mini bar was the highlight
review.negativeRemarks: Everything. Offer room service. Have a professional front deck staff, paint the elevator, serve coffee by 5am, put the coffee makers back in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Great wine store around the corner

review.reviewText: The Hotel Monaco is a very nice boutique hotel located only a few blocks from Union Square. It also has a very nice new bar and restaurant inside the hotel so you can explore the city or choose to "cocoon" if you want ;-)
Hotel with good central location, but can be noisy at night with city traffic, etc.
Great holiday very good location but turn right when you leave the hotel rather than left to avoid the less desirable area.

review.title: very nice, not too big hotel in the centre ow town
review.reviewText: room was small but suffient. Staff very peasant. Design is well balanced. Very good bar. Dogs allowed :-)
review.positiveRemarks: pleasant staff. Nice design. Good bar.
review.negativeRemarks: room was a bit at the small end
review.locationRemarks: centre of town. No further explanation needed.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Excellent restaurant, friendly staff, great location.

review.title: Over all a great stay
review.reviewText: Very nice location, girls at reception desk can be more friendly but over all I had a very nice stay and recommend this hotel
review.locationRemarks: Very close to union square, shopping, tons of restaurants and a quick ride to fisherman's wharf

review.title: disappointed when I walk into my room
review.reviewText: The room is super small, Expedia rates this hotel 4.5, I totally don't think so. This hotel didn't even have a sliper when I asked for it, you have to pay extra for tooth brush, and even shower cap is not really in the room for you. Hotle is old, and the pillow coverage is all wrinkle, it make me feels like it's not "fresh" like the other hotles. I paid for two night, and I check out 1 day early even they wouldn't reture the money back to me.
Was in town for a conference so spent little time in the room.. Room was small but neat. Liked the in room refrigerator.  The safe was wide enough for my laptop. Easy walk to Moscone Center.

review.title: Avoid during renovation and if u lik to sleep late
review.reviewText:
The hotel looks great outside and in, but they are renovating the restaurant so:
1. There is no room service. We were planning on having breakfast in bed Saturday morning.
2. They started testing the fire alarm Saturday at 9am

Also, the room service started doing rounds Saturday at 8:30am or so, and not only they woke us up, but were very noisy taking care of other rooms that we could not sleep more.

The room / bed / cleanness as such were great.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText:
The Monaco is in a good location in San Francisco. It's near Union Square and the Civic Center, and convenient to BART stations and the cable car line. Several good eating establishments are nearby as well.

My stay included the Presidents' Day weekend, so I wasn't certain how busy the hotel might be, but I was able to check in early upon arrival on a Sunday. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable (although there was absolutely no view).

I broke my ankle while in town, and was in a walking cast during my stay. Fortunately, it was easy to traverse to and from my room (near the elevator) to the lobby/hotel entrance without a lot of extra steps. 

The wine hour and morning pastry/coffee bar were nice. I was disappointed that the restaurant was closed for remodeling. I feel that should have been disclosed prior to arrival - either by the Monaco or by Expedia - as I typically use such facilities and would have done so this time.

Overall, my stay (four nights) was a good experience.

review.title: Convenient to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and the staff friendly.  There was a bottle of chilled champagne waiting in our room when we arrived. I had mentioned it was our 25th anniversary. We were near the elevator, so loud guests could be easily heard, but that was not a deal breaker.
Rooms need to be updated. Carpet was dirty.  Comforter between sheets needed to be washed. They didn't vacuum room before we arrived, we found someone else's medicine pill on the floor.

review.title: Handy for downtown shops and restaurants
review.reviewText:
Good location,easy walking to shops and restaurants. Staff very helpful and polite.the restaurant was being renovated and had been closed for a long time. Meals therefor had to be taken outside but plenty of restaurants.

A negative for us was the harassment from beggars on every street corner in that area. Unpleasant and off putting.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, good value for money,clean.
review.locationRemarks: Geary street location, theatres nearby but not a busy theatre district. Just a few minutes walk to shops,Union Square etc.

The staff was pretty helpful. The hotel itself was ok, smaller than I imagined. The room was ok, not very big and the bed wasn't very comfortable. I did love the Leopard Print robes though. They did have coffee and tea in the mornings which was nice. They also had wine hour in the lobby, never checked it out. 

Overall It was ok, I don't think I would stay here again because I didn't find it amazing or very comfortable.

Amazing location. Exceptional service, beautiful room decor for the price paid. Very reasonable price- included were complimentary items provided if needed- i.e. nail clipper, nail file, etc. Also happy hour daily, which we didnt take advantage off- but certainly a fun event for hotel guests to enjoy. We stayed as a couple and enjoyed it.

a beautifully updated old-school hotel in the heart of the shopping district- a short walk and many long hilly walks to all that the beautiful city by the bay has to offer.
Evening wine was a wonderful way to relax "at home" before heading out for more fun.
My young adult sons were staying on the side of the hotel where construction was happening (jackhammers promptly at 9am) - this probably wouldn't bother many other guests - as most folks are up and about sightseeing or working by then - but their age group/vacation and jet lag necessitated a later rise. The hotel staff was very kind and accomodating - changing their room while we were out for the day.
There are bikes to take on first come first serve basis - but we did not take advantage of this - Concierge service is really anyone- as Everyone was very helpful!

I recommend for business travelers or tourists.  Hotel Monaco located on the borderline of the gritty Tenderloin. Do not let that discourage you.  The Clift Hotel across the Street featuring the Redwood Room more than makes up for the Hotel Monaco's restaurant and bar being closed for renovations.

review.title: Disappointing Stay
review.reviewText:
We booked a junior suite for 4 nights. Price was  300+ /night with taxes/fees included.   

Experience Day 1 and Day 2:  Rating 1
Our room had horrible clanging and vibrations in the walls.  Maintenance and engineering were unable to find source and fix the problem. It was a series of vertical rooms - not just ours.  The hotel was full, so we couldn't move till day 3.  They did comp us one night, and I didn't argue about getting 2nd night comp'd but we definitely didn't have enjoyable stay these 2 nights. 

Experience Day 3 and Day 4: Rating 3
New room had no noise.  It had no jaccuzi tub though (again not what I paid for) - but at least I could sleep. 

Rooms were roomy and nicely decorated - had king size bed and sleeper sofa. 

Cleanliness:  In both rooms there was some mold in the tub/shower grout and in the second room there were cracked tiles in the tub.  Again at this price point, there should not be mold.

Restaurant closed -  you get ticket for one Danish/one fruit for breakfast - but they still ran out of food.  Are Danish really that expensive that you can't order a little extra to make sure they don't run out?  

Wine reception was good.

Staff were professional, polite, and tried to help.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice décor, lobby is beautiful, fireplaces in lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: More food at continental breakfast, room maintenance, mold removal in tubs.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is on border of union square and tenderloin districts - so if you go "right" you have shops, theater and restaurants - don't go "left".

Surely, the could have squeezed in a little, comfy chair somewhere?  And the hotel room was dirty, probably because in many very obvious areas, it had not been cleaned or dusted in awhile. It absolutely should have been. And I wish I knew why your husband did not like the pocket door. Overall, we are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay. We are looking forward to the renovation of the restaurant to be completed.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent a week at Hotel Monaco. We found the location convenient and the hotel in general comfortable and quiet. The room was clean and spacious (as SF hotel rooms go) with a nice sized television. We both thought the bed was a little hard, but I loved the down pillows. The fridge didn't seem to work but that wasn't a big deal. We just used the ice machine. My husband didn't care for the pocket door in the bathroom. Also, we were on the second floor and there was some noise from the renovations taking place below in the restaurant. We were given coupons for a pastry and beverage each day of our stay, but found we didn't actually use them due to the hours we kept. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great and the staff were very friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel Monaco is just a couple of blocks from Union Square, shopping, restaurants, and public transportation.

review.title: Extremely Disappointed
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel 6 weeks in advance. Arrived to find that the spa and dining, including room service, key features being this was an anniversary trip, were not available because of construction. Our room was comfortable but noise pervaded, jack hammers during the day, waterpipes from other rooms and loud AC vents at night. There was also black mold in the shower. We requested another room the following day and got a quieter room at the other side of the hotel. The staff was courteous overall but not overly so considering the circumstances. I asked why they hadn't sent me an email in advance to let me know that 2 primary features of their 4 star hotel would not be accessible during my stay? They said they did send an email "one day in advance of your stay" to guests, but because I booked thru Expedia I was not included. I'm also a Kimpton Hotel member but they made it clear when we checked in that because we booked thru Expedia we would not be afforded any membership benefits (the rate we paid was no different). Extremely disappointed.

managementResponses.response: Please do not hesitate to ask us to see other rooms. We are always happy to show you different options. Some of our rooms are smaller than others. And sometimes a different layout makes all the difference for people.

review.title: Excellent Hotel.
review.reviewText:
This was our first experience with a Kimpton Hotel, and we were very pleased.  The highlights would be the excellent staff.  Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping was extremely pleasant and professional.  They went out of their way to make sure our needs were met.  This was a birthday weekend trip for my husband, and I called ahead to request a view room on a higher floor.  My request was met, and we were given a room on the 7th floor.  Once in our room we were surprised by a beautiful bottle of wine and a hand written birthday card for my husband.  The 7th floor was very quiet, very little outside noise. However, you are in the city! The room was an average size by SF standards, nicely decorated.  Very clean.  Nice sized bathroom.  Good shower head and water pressure.  Very comfortable bed.  They also supply you with terry animal print bathrobes, (I love up a soft terry bathrobe) however, these robes were not very soft.  Oh well. We did miss both the tea hour and the free wine hour.  Maybe next time. Overall our stay was excellent and we will certainly be staying here again. 

























Overall our experience was excellent and we will certainly be staying here again.

review.title: Surprising quality for the price, beautiful!
review.reviewText: You can't beat the location of this hotel. Close to Union Square, transportation hubs, shopping, cable cars and historic buildings. We were very surprised at the excellent quality of the rooms, the condition of the hotel and all the amenities we go for the price we paid. They have a Complimentary wine bar and hot cider with whiskey (or without) from 5 to 6 each night which is unheard of in San Francisco. No limits either, we went back for seconds and thirds and where happily served. The rooms are very comfortable with nice decorative touches and super comfortable beds. The management of this hotel clearly takes pride in their property and makes every guest feel welcome and pampered. Rooms were very clean and had 5 star amenities such as robes, in room safe, refrigerator and all the toiletries you could every want supplied in the room. This will be our go-to hotel in SF from now on.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and quality of property and rooms.
