We got excellent recommendations for restaurants in the area and really enjoyed the bikes the hotel provides for free (there are only six, but we were lucky to get four even after sleeping in until 10:30 am) Also, the hotel has two beautiful rooms with fire places close to the lobby, and hotel guest can enjoy free drinks in the morning and evening.
review.positiveRemarks: great decor, friendly staff, comfortable room with fire place near the lobby, Grand Cafe in the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is right around the corner, lots of theaters, China Town just a couple of blocks away

review.title: Beautiful hotel in a very convenient location
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. Spacious room, friendly staff, fantastic service.
review.negativeRemarks: Couldn't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: Location is two small blocks from Union Square. It was very convenient and accessible. Highly recommended.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location, friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Union square shopping. Good restaurants and bars near by.

review.title: Underwhelmed
review.reviewText: The experience was not fabulous. First of all there was hair on the water cup I wanted to use to get a drink when we first arrived in the room. Gross. The service at the hotel leaves something to be desired. I had to leave a message to order room service because no one would pick up. Then after waiting 25 minutes for a cab I decided to walk to the corner and hail my own, the valet yelled at me because there were other people waiting in line. It looked to me as though they were all able bodied individuals who could hail their own cabs at anytime if they wanted instead of wait for an incompetent person to do it for them. When we tried to eat in the hotel restaurant we stood around for about 20 minutes and none of the staff even acknowledged us, let alone asked if we would like to be seated so we left and ate somewhere else. Also the hotel is in the ghetto. Be prepared to have homeless people asking you for change every time you step outside. I was very underwhelmed and won't be staying at Kimpton hotels again. Seriously, the Motel 6 would have been just as good. I definitely believe there are plenty of other nicer hotels for the same price, so do yourself a favor
review.locationRemarks: The Tenderloin, need I say more?

review.reviewText:
I really liked the place and will likely come again. M y only complaints were no newspapers by
8:15 AM on Sunday, and air vent blowing either hot air (at or above 69F) or cold air (at or
below 68F) rather than room temperature air. GAB
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of wine at 5 Pm wine serving. More chairs at wine serving.

review.reviewText:
I really liked the place and will likely come again. M y only complaints were no newspapers by

review.negativeRemarks: Quality of wine at 5 Pm wine serving. More chairs at wine serving.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText:
Very comfortable rooms. Easy access to the rest of San Francisco. The lobby with the giant fireplace and free coffee in the morning was a huge perk. Friendly staff.

The attached restaurant has great quality food but the prices are a bit high. Our friend had severe good allergies and we were blown away when the chef came out to talk to her. That's great service. The wait staff could use a little more training though. Just small things like clearing away all the dirty stuff before new things come to the table and asking if you'd like another drink when the first one is done.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Loved everything.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText:
Hotel location is a huge plus as it was the first trip to San Francisco!
Located within walking distance from Union Square with lots of good eateries and shopping heart of the city.
The Concierge is great! Eddie in particular was superb as he's always very helpful and gave us lots of good tips for the go-to areas.
I would certainly recommend to anyone this hotel....
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Location and Location! Friendly staff!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Price for the parking is way too steep!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Eating, Shopping....

review.title: Great staff, cool hotel, family friendly
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Monaco. We had a room with 2 double beds on a high floor overlooking the street. The room was very modern and clean and the beds were comfy. The valets and porters were all extremely, genuinely, nice and helpful people. The front desk staff were also great, when I had to re-print my tickets for Alcatraz (because I left them at home on the refrigerator door at home) the woman at the front desk was happy to help me out. The adjacent Grand cafe has amazing food. Only complaints: the shower had extremely low water pressure, if we hadn't already unpacked we would have requested another room. Also, iHome iPhone mp3 player didn't work, not a big deal but it would have been nice to have. Those things aside I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, decor, modern touches like bike rentals, pet friendly, and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, cable cars, Grand Cafe, many restaurants and bars.

review.reviewText: The hotel was just as lovely as the pictures showed in the information when booking. Our daughter had to bring her dog and that went very well. The staff was very helpful, kind and courteous. Our stay was exceptional!! Would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was clean and well cared for. We enjoyed the wine from 5-6 each evening.
review.locationRemarks: We were very close to Union Square and able to walk down to see the holiday decorations. Bus connections were close.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and tidy. Great location, friendly staff, very speedy check in, and the free wine hour was a plus. The room was a bit small and cramped but the decor was very nice and inviting. Would definatley stay there again.

review.title: A nice package with excellent staff
review.reviewText:
Had a very pleasant time and enjoyed the "extras". By extras I mean good (free) coffee in the AM in their "living room", newspaper, flavored water during the day, and the wine tasting each night. The wine tasting was more than a taste - a full glass (and more if you wanted it) along with a mix of snack food (cheese, crackers, pretzels). We arrived a bit early and were given coupons for drinks in the attached restaurant while the room was being prepared - nothing we asked for but appreciated. The room was eclectically decorated. One of the few places that still has cotton balls and q-tips in the bathroom. We had dinner in the attached restaurant the last night and it was very good. My spouse had the mussels - they were huge. The last time we had them that meaty was in Tasmania. We typically go to San Francisco each year for a visit and right now this is probably the place we'll stay next trip. (We have friends who recommend other Kimpton properties nearby so who knows.)

I rarely talk about staff at hotels because we don't interact with them that much. This time I'd like to commend the bell staff, particularly Eddie, for being particularly responsive and helpful. The front desk was great as well.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, well laid out room, staff, extras.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square with all the restaurants, theater, and shopping that implies.

review.title: Great Hotel and Location, but overpriced Valet
review.reviewText: Only stayed one night at the hotel before flying out and we had a great stay. However, the $58 valet (after tax) price is way overpriced considering the room was about $300 night. Valet and the lack of free Wifi are the only negatives everything else was at or above my expectations.
review.negativeRemarks: FREE WIFI!!!!!! It is located in the Bay and should better reflect the attitude of the area. Wifi is considered just another utility and not a luxury

review.title: Close to great shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was great & loved the decor,
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping & restaurants, close to Union Square

review.title: Quiet clean hotel located in the Union Square area
Nice Hotel with character
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with character. Location is fairly central the the multitude of things to see and do in San Francisco. It is also close to restaurants and public transit. Staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. It was our first experience with a Kimpton hotel, and it has set our expectations.

review.title: Very accomodating
review.reviewText:
We were n SF for the Nike race. The hotel did many extras to make it comfortable for the runners. They gad a coffee/tea/hot chocolate bar available each morning. Race day morning they added muffins, bagels & fruit for us.
My visiting ftiends cell battery died n their lobby- they quickly got her a charger so she could make calls.
Perfectly located by Union Square. Couldn't b happier with this hotel.

review.title: Fantastically helpful staff and a good locaiton
review.reviewText: Stayed for three nights at the end of September/start of October 2013 on the recommendation of a friend, and booked a junior suite, which turned out to be located at the front of the hotel. We found the staff friendly and helpful from the outset. On the first night, I only had three hours' sleep because of drunks singing outside on the street. My husband spoke to reception about this at 7.30am, and staff immediately agreed to move us - we were upgraded to a Deluxe suite at the rear of the building. This was very much appreciated, but the owners may wish to consider improving the glazing in room 320 so that outside noise does not wake guests. That blip aside, we loved our stay at the Monaco. The reception staff were knowledgeable and helpful regarding local restaurants, the Jacuzzi was very welcome after a day spent walking a lot, and I loved the quirky animal print dressing gowns and the yoga mats in the rooms. The beds were very comfortable. On our last day, we had an evening meal at the attached French cafe, and really enjoyed it. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if we visit San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff, good location, comfortable beds, Jacuzzi, good French cafe attached.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing that needs to be improved is the glazing and general soundproofing of the rooms at the front of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Powell St BART station, so easy access from SFO and easy to get around the city by bus. Also close to Union Sq for shopping.

review.title: beautiful in great location
review.reviewText:
for a dntn hotel nice gym.

short. walks to restaurants and
theater

only improvement, TV too focused
on selling me movies

otherwise, outstanding!

review.title: Beautiful modern hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Great, helpful staff. Inexpensive cab rides to everywhere. Cable car & Union Square 2 blocks away. 20 minute ride from SFO airport. Restaurants close enough to walk.
review.positiveRemarks: Again, staff was fabulous. Wine reception every evening was a really nice touch. They have complementary bicycles for use, if so inclined.
review.negativeRemarks: This was my second stay in San Francisco...never noticed as many homeless people in the streets last time.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, shopping, Cable Cars, art galleries all within walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Recently updated blocks away from everything, I enjoyed my stay. I wish the hotel bar better. Only conplaint was a blood stain on the comforter cover. Gross.

review.title: Very nice visit
review.reviewText: Hadn't been in San Francisco for some time. My wife and I had a very nice stay here with our standard poodle. The room, staff and cafe were all excellent. If you want a lovely hotel that makes you comfortable with your pet this is it.

review.title: Short Stay
review.reviewText: Very central with short walk to Union Square. Great meals at Pinecrest Diner just a block away. Comfortable room which has no coffee making facilities but coffee and tea are available in the mornings in the lounge.

review.title: Nice place in a great location.
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Hotel in the past and it is a good value. The staff was helpful and huge room was fine, although small. For the union square area that is to be expected.

review.title: Nice hotel close to restaurants and shopping
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, nice clean hotel room had everything we needed. Close walking to main attractions in San Francisco.

review.title: Escape to Monaco
review.reviewText: Hotel Monaco is an oasis in the urban jungle of the Union Square area. The staff are friendly and exceptional, and the hosted wine hour is a daily treat after a day of sight seeing.

review.title: Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: We were here 2 years ago and we came back because it is in a very good position even if it is a bit expensive
review.positiveRemarks: The position, the room aren't very large but they are renewed and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: With the complimentary coffee in the morning there could be some cakes
review.locationRemarks: The location is very good, you can reach every part of San Francisco very easily

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: great location cute rooms, easy access to union square

review.title: Very nice, exceeded my expectations!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel's exterior embodies that old San Francisco charm from the sixties and doesnt look much to speak of. Once you step inside the hotel, the interior is warm, comfortable, and well decorated. I was traveling alone and found the room somewhat small, however it was very clean ,quiet and meet my expectations. The staff from the valet to housekeeping were outstanding and attentive. I would stay here definitely again.
review.locationRemarks: close to union square

review.title: Very Welcoming
review.reviewText: The staff was very nice and welcoming they made you feel like a part of a large family.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to Powell & Hyde, which is a must ride to get to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Excellent place to stay
review.reviewText: Great staff, complimentary wine was a great added touch. Best hotel in the downtown area.

review.title: Charming hotel!
review.reviewText:
Hotel Monaco was wonderful for our family. We stayed two nights and had a very pleasant stay. The beds were unbelievable comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and efficient. Our boys had two goldfish, "Ariel and Sebastian", it was just a different touch on the usual hotel stay.

All and all great experience! We would definitely stay again the next time we are in the City!

review.title: Exceptional staff
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located in Union Square and right next to the Grand Cafe which is a great spot for drinks and breakfast. We were originally given a room that smelled very smoky and I immediately alerted them and they moved us promptly. We forgot one of our bags in the room and didn't realize it until we got back at 1 AM. We alerted the front desk and Issac went above and beyond to make sure we got that bag back within 30 minutes. Everyone on the desk was pleasant and very accommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was fine - small but clean with a rather large, nice bathroom. Great location Grand Cafe next door

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: The Hotel and all the employee's are great. Once we stepped foot inside we knew we made the right choice. The neighborhood doesn't look all to nice, but from strolling through most of San Fran its all the same.
review.positiveRemarks: How nice and tidy the hotel was
review.negativeRemarks: The parking, but pretty much all of Frisco is like this.
review.locationRemarks: I think its the perfect location. Not as crowded as fisherman warf. Transportation close by. neighborhood doesn't look very nice at night though

review.title: Hotel Monaco SF
review.reviewText: The staff was amazing as was the Sauna, Steam Room, Gym. The location was perfect for getting around SF. BUT... The room was smaller than in pictures, the bed was worn, the pillows were terrible, and the view was looking over the trash / dumpsters!
review.negativeRemarks: Beds/Pillows/ overall room.
review.locationRemarks: Great food, music and shopping.

review.title: Old world charm!
review.reviewText: Great location superb customer service & classic old world charm. The drinks reception each evening was a lovely touch & the spa & sauna were relaxing! My daughter & I loved it!
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of union square with easy access to cable cars & muni

review.title: Great location-very modern decor in rooms.
review.reviewText: Elegant decor in two lobby areas. Nice workout room. Very good restaurant attached and great location just a few blocks from Union Square. Free WIFI. ould stay again in a heartbeat.
review.negativeRemarks: Great as is
review.locationRemarks: Union square, shopping, dining, cable cars

review.title: Nice little hotel, questionable area.
review.reviewText:
Driving in to the area, I was beginning to wonder if I was in the right part of town. The area at night has a somewhat "seedy" feel to it. Given most hotels' valet prices, I chose to part in a lot adjacent to the hotel for much cheaper.

Once inside the hotel, it was somewhat small, but very well decorated. The room was somewhat small, with a view of the side of the adjacent building, and nothing else. The room decoration was a mix of eclectic, baroque, and a little bit funky... I loved it. Very stylish, very well thought-out.
review.positiveRemarks: The vibe, the decor. It was within a reasonable walking distance from ChinaTown if you don't mind the walk.
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk personnel could be friendlier, he was very professional, but not very warm. He reminded me of my stays in France.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of night life nearby, ChinaTown within walking distance, if you like to walk.

review.title: Great location for everything in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location for every interest when visiting San Francisco - shopping, sightseeing, beaches, seeing the different areas of the city. Very boutique in design if you like it - I did! Very welcoming and helpful staff. The spa was nice but simple - just a jacuzzi, steam and sauna rooms. Treatments are professionally delivered, but a little pricey. The room and robes smelt a little old and musty. I also didn't get the best view as my room looked into someone elses apartment including their washing line! I guess this should be expected of a city centre location.
review.negativeRemarks: Musty smelling robes. Would have liked a swimming pool.
review.locationRemarks: Three blocks from Union Square, perfect for walking everywhere

review.title: Great little hotel near Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Clean rooms, lovely decor! Wonderful staff very helpful.
Loved the wine reception!!

review.title: Will come back!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff we excellent and always helpful. Loved the location- close to transport, shops and places to eat. The room was very comfortable and we enjoyed the robes! Definitely will stay here again!

review.title: Not as good as reviews state...
review.reviewText: Very very disappointing hotel. I won't go into details, all I can say is that this hotel does not reserve rating it had. It is not clean, it smells like a restroom in the lobby area. Rooms are old and outdated and AC is super loud and won't even cool your room properly (yes, in SF where it is pretty cool outside our room would get stuffy and hot). Worse part of the stay is the BED. It's very uncomfortable and is bad quality mattress. I'd suggest to stay elsewhere since there are so many other choice around Union SQ.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds, AC, shower, lobby area

review.title: Good hotel, friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Hotel was about what you would expect for the price and location. Room was comfortable, clean, and modern. Hotel staff was very good. The bellhop asked if we would like to have goldfish brought up to the room for our 5 year old daughter to have for the night. We said yes and a little while later a housekeeper brought up a live goldfish and a complimentary bottle of sparkling cider with cookies (Remember- tip the hotel staff and good things will happen). Valet parking in the hotel was $52 a night. To get free WiFi you had to sign up for the Kimpton rewards program. It was free and only took about two minutes; after that I used the WiFi for free without any issues.
review.negativeRemarks: Could always lower the price...
review.locationRemarks: Downtown S.F., you can find anything you want.

review.title: Great hotel, ideal location
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at the Hotel Monaco. The location is very convenient - just two blocks from Union Square, walking distance to many great sites (including AT&T park) and easy access to cable cars and all other transit. The hotel staff were great - very helpful when we needed them, totally unobtrusive when we didn't. The styling in the hotel is great as well - really chic. Our room was perfectly comfortable, and I was impressed with the convenience of the power outlets - a really thoughtful touch. We will definitely look to stay here again.

review.title: Will return to the Monaco!
review.reviewText: Great little spa in the lower level. Restaurant and bar were very good. The bar had very good service. The free loaner bikes were a great touch as was the complimentary iced tea and water in the lobby.

review.title: Friendly helpful staff
review.reviewText: A lovely, comfortable hotel, very close to union square. The staff are fantastic and very friendly and make you feel very welcome.
review.locationRemarks: Just a couple of blocks from union square. Close to shops and restaurants

review.title: Nice hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. Rooms were small, but of a good quality. The hotel staff was great: knowledgeable, helpful, polite. Not the best views. The location was great. Easy walking to lots of shops and restaurants, public transit, and even pretty close to the Embarcadero.

review.title: A great small hotel in a perfect location
review.reviewText: We have stayed in several hotels in San Francisco over the years, but Monaco will definitely be our new favorite! Excellent staff, beautiful but warm and friendly environment and comfortable amenities made this a nearly perfect experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Don't overlook the Grand Cafe restaurant associated with the hotel. It was our best dining experience of the trip.
review.negativeRemarks: A true concierge would be a good addition. Front desk performance of these duties was uneven - some were very helpful, others were not.
review.locationRemarks: Great Union Square location is close to cable cars and other public transportation. And lotsof great restaurants.

review.title: Great Time, Great Hotel.
review.reviewText:
Great location, Friendly helpful staff, comfortable smart hotel.

Hotel Bar needs to stay open later especially on weekends, but apart from that, great time in San Francisco!!
review.negativeRemarks: Bar closed to early
review.locationRemarks: Great location easy to walk to everything

review.title: Great Hotel with great service
review.reviewText: This is our second stay at Hotel Monaco in San Francisco. They are very welcoming, the rooms are clean, and service is excellent. They attend to your needs if you call & provide a great atmosphere & comfortable environment. We would highly recommend this hotel, it's close to downtown but also assess to the Muni is close by and you can visit the outer districts/neighborhoods.
review.positiveRemarks: Service is excellent, the staff are very professional/welcoming, whimsical design of the hotel rooms
review.locationRemarks: Hotel Monaco is near Union square, you can walk around downtown or walk to the Muni and take it to many other outer districts & neighborhood.

review.title: SJS in SFO
review.reviewText: Great service; appreciated afternoon wine and cheese; doormen gave great service
review.negativeRemarks: Phone charge of $1 for every call: 800 numbers, credit card calls
review.locationRemarks: Amazing for SFO activities

review.title: AP journey out
review.reviewText: HOtel was very small and Had a terrible view of the Wall.. Cleaning people were a little over eager knocking at 8 am on sunday, but other then that not a bad experience..

review.title: Could not wish for more!
review.reviewText: Great location, complimentary wine, bicycle, spa, sauna, bathrobes and a fantastic ambiance; what else would one want???
review.positiveRemarks: Complimentary bike, sauna, bathrobe, wine, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: dogs are allowed...
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic but don't go South into the Tenderloin district...

review.title: A terrific find in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great lobby! A caring staff and lots of little touches that made it a pleasure to stay here. Location is great for most San Francisco sightseeing. I will happily stay here again.

review.title: Decadent
review.reviewText:
Love the artwork, sculptures and the decadence of this place. Think theatrical meets Versailles!
Interesting unique furniture pieces everywhere.

review.title: Great for family
review.reviewText: Great location, very good service and clean rooms.

review.title: Nice hotel...
review.reviewText: Had a great stay, the staff was very accommodating, the hotel was very charming and the room was very chic. The location was ideal.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and warmth of the hotel. Friendly staff..
review.negativeRemarks: Parking...
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to all transportation

review.title: Little wonky, but great location
review.reviewText:
The location for this place is fantastic--rightly accessible to everything downtown has to offer and easy long-walking distance to the waterfront.

The room itself was cleanly appointed and kept very tidy. The complimentary services provided are pleasant and appropriate though we missed the complimentary bicycle service.

The room layout feels like the same layout I've slept in dozens of times before--rather eerily so, really. The room and bathroom were quite tiny and compact, but as a place to safely and cleanly crash, it was fine. Everything is coated in a rather quirky and pleasant veneer that the layout and size don't end up being anything but much of a distraction.

I'd probably come back to this place but I'd certainly try some of the other hotels in the area first.

review.title: Great Trip!
review.reviewText: We loved the charm of this hotel and the staff could not have been more efficient. While they were professional the real plus was that they all were so warm, friendly and made you feel so welcomed.

review.title: Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice location, boutique style, great restaurant and bar

review.title: A lovely place for a romantic get away for two.
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent a long romantic weekend here in December. The staff and the room were both superb. Our room was recently remodelled and was in great condition. Every staff member we interacted with was cheerful, kind and very helpful. I would stay here again. The only thing that I would improve upon would be the Cafe in the hotel. The food was okay, but there are so many better places to eat in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the room were great.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant in the hotel could have better food.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for shopping and the downtown core.

review.title: can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The hotel has a light-hearted vibe and a great spa! Right in the heart of theaters, shopping and great food.
review.positiveRemarks: location, decor, happy hour, restaurant, spa, friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: expensive to park
review.locationRemarks: perfcect

review.title: Tiny room, not worth the price
review.reviewText: Tiny bedroom, view of a back wall, not worth the price. moved to Wyndham parc 55. Great room, great view, half the price.

review.title: No Ideal for your stay in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: I couldn't rest because constantly the housekeeper will get in without knocking my door in the morning. I couldn't find a not distrub signed in the room. Noone a good hotel for business and one night only. They make you feel uncomfortable and they very pushy on just being nice for the sake of the tips. Do not go in this hotel. Parking crazy expensive $60 per day completely overrate it. Also they will make you feel you are the one paid through expedia and not their ridiculous price.

review.title: San Francisco quirky elegance
review.reviewText: Love the quirky, elegant ambience of the Monaco but our room was rather small and the Grand Cafe closes between breakfast, lunch, and dinner which isn't convenient for those who want to sleep in and have a late breakfast. But overall a great hotel, conveniently located, and wonderful, friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The Grand Cafe's hours
review.locationRemarks: Perfect! Close to Union Square and across the street from a Walgreens.

review.title: rooms are a little small
review.reviewText: The room was quite small and the window opened onto other rooms mere feet away.
review.locationRemarks: Great location - a couple of blocks off Union Square. Close to great shopping, restaurants and other activities.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The room was VERY small. It was clean and the bed was comfy. The Lobby rug was disgustingly dirty. Overall, due to the price from Expedia, we were pleased.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby dirty
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: not worth the price
review.reviewText: okay, its not worth the price you pay. there is no door lock for the restrooms

review.title: dave's view
review.reviewText: very attentive to your needs. great location. very clean. has a business center, didn't need to haul a computer along. no surprise fees. really liked the place.

review.title: Great hotel in a good location, sort of.
review.reviewText: This was a very lovely hotel with lots of great facilities and nice staff. The rooms, especially the junior suites were spacious and were quiet despite being on a main road. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Union Square, but don't be put off too much by the high number of homeless around the hotel.

review.title: A pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Centrally located , nice , clean , friendly staffs,
review.negativeRemarks: No tea or coffee making facility in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located , 2 block from union square

review.title: Great location. Very romantic.
review.reviewText: The bedroom and bath were very clean and the decor was fresh. There was plenty of space to move around.

review.title: Nice hotel, ok location...
review.reviewText:
The staff at the hotel was super friendly and very helpful from the moment we walked in the door. The room was really nice and the bed was very comfortable. Traffic noise was light and the location convenience was very good.

The only thing that I was really surprised about because I had not read in any reviews is the environment around the hotel. It wasn't very clean and there were many homeless people that hung around nearby. It made it feel like it wasn't a very safe location, but we were assured by some local guests that it would be fine.

review.title: Loved the Monaco San Francisco!
review.reviewText: We had a great time at the Monaco! My husband and I enjoyed the Grand cafe, the wine hour, and the room! Also the location was wonderful- so close to everything!
review.negativeRemarks: Room service
review.locationRemarks: Very close to union square and amazing restaurants! Close to public transfer, too!

review.title: We'll stay again!
review.reviewText: We usually stay at the Fairmont in San Francisco. We decided to give this hotel a try because was full during this trip. This hotel exceeded our expectations. We only stayed one night but would stay there again.

review.title: Love this place
review.reviewText: Love the bar, love the rooms, love the service. love the location.

review.title: Great place for a getaway for 2, SF right there!
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, uniquely and beautifully decorated room, friendly and well-attended (and free) wine happy hour daily from 5-6 PM. Excellent convenience to theaters, dining, Union Square. Reasonable exercise room. Only disappointment was a small closet.

review.title: Cozy,convenient, comfortable and full of character
review.reviewText: I reeally enjoyed this hotel - great location, eccentric "eclectic" design and great staff. I will definitely stay there on my next visit to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed had a canopy ... the hotel was all in all charming.
review.locationRemarks: A minute from Union Square and even closer to the theatre district.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Is a very clean hotel, which this is very important to me. The room are a normal size, not too big not too small. Is located in Union Square, we walked everywhere from here to Nob Hill, Pacific Height, Fisherman Wharf, etc. The Mall and all fancy stores are two blocks away. The Staff always welcomes you and help you with any questions you have. The only bad thing I would say is the restaurant and bar the staff are the worst and the food is not good or even the menu, you only have a few options. And the hotel is expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar Area
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Monaco Hotel San Francisco. VERY disappointing
review.reviewText: Small Pokey dark room with enormous mirror to give an illusion of space. Dirty windows made the room look grey and dingy. Poor lighting conditions especially in bathroom.Shower area dingy and unlit.. Never again.We checked out and didn't bother with the second night.
review.negativeRemarks: The room
review.locationRemarks: satisfactory

review.title: Favourite hotel in SF!
review.reviewText: It was our second stay at the Monaco hotel in San Francisco and it was just fantastic. We love the design of the hotel. The wine hour is a great time to relax after a day out and enjoy some local wines as well as treats from the Grand Cafe restaurant next door. The rooms are beautiful and the location of the hotel is only few blocks away from Union Square. Finally, the staff is so friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Few blocks away from Union Square.

review.title: Great hotel for Bay Area visit.
review.reviewText: Previous experience with this hotel led us back for this visit. Desk staff was very helpful about moving us to a higher floor. The room was on the small side but very comfortable and clean and just right for what we needed.
review.negativeRemarks: There is no on-site parking. Valet service is $50 per day. Nearby parking is $25-$30 per day.
review.locationRemarks: Great location -- drug store, coffee, restaurants, shopping, transit all within walking distance.

review.title: Not 4 star
review.reviewText:
Our plane was very late landing and we were lucky that we called the hotel. We learned when we phoned that after midnight the room could have been provided to another guest. I will never understand why this information is not boldly posted for travelers, planes are late every day.

I booked the room through Expedia, the pictures a bit deceiving. The room was small,but clean and convenient. I would not have stay an extended period of time in this hotel. The am complimentary coffee service is very good, quality product and well attended by the hotel staff.

Our biggest issue came when we departed. We needed to rent a car which was a few blocks from the hotel, we asked if we could leave the bags until we retrieved the car, the front door man told us we could roll our bags down to Hertz, hardly service for a 4 star hotel.

review.title: Homelessness in ASan Francisco
review.reviewText:
the hotel wass great and the staff were exceptional.Iit was situated in a very accessible part of the city and the only issue was the barrage of people constantly asking for money nearly every 5th step. The homeless issue in San Francisco is one that needs addressing, but not sure how they will solve it.
Shame it is iat it's height in the same part of the city as the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: the environs

review.title: Hotel Monaco, San Francisco
review.reviewText: For the money, the towels were very thin, there was a dearth of electrical outlets, the bathroom needs ANY ventilation and only one sink was an issue with three of us trying to get ready in the morning. Staff was great and the restaurant was good. There were empty Coke bottles under the bed that did not belong to us and cigarette butts on the ledge outside our window.
review.positiveRemarks: It's close to shopping, museums, Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room with some housekeeping issues.
review.locationRemarks: Great for shopping, restaurants.

review.title: Memphis loved the Hotel Monaco!
review.reviewText: Hotel Monaco has so much character and we just loved it. My 7 year old loved the lobby monkies. It has a great location. The staff was genuinely friendly and helpful.

review.title: Hotel Monaco
review.reviewText: the hotel was quirky in style, but gorgeous, clean, friendly staff, ...we felt well cared for. We would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice people, good free coffee and tea in the mornings, comfortable room
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, not too far from BART....we ran the gauntlet of the Homeless around the hotel, but that can happen anywhere in San Fran.

review.title: superb hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location, wonderful hotel decoration and marvelous restaurant ! we will definitely come back, withough any doubt.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText:
while the room was a bit small, it was very comfortable. The staff was very freindly and most helpful in all areas. The front desk and door staff were superb and the cleaning staff was very friendly/
Wine reception was great and free newspapers and coffee was welcome.
While the neighborhood gets a littel "sketchy" at night, it did not impede our stay
review.negativeRemarks: Neighborhood
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square but the number of homeless was larger at night

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The room was tiny and the TV was located in a way that could barely be watched. Very few amenities for the price. The massage therapist was so rough I am still recovering. No, I do not recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The room
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Very good Hotel in the center of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Stayed four nights at this hotel and was impressed with the service. The room was very comfortable, quite and clean with a very very good bed. Also what makes the difference was the service.
review.negativeRemarks: lack of parking, however valet parking worked perfect but added the cost
review.locationRemarks: Very good location just 5 min walk from Union sq

review.title: A Small Delight
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located and the staff was very helpful. Rooms are a bit small, but entirely adequate.
review.positiveRemarks: The provide free use of their computer to issue boarding passes.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was a bit small for two.
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly located

review.title: Wonderful hotel on Union Square without crowd!
review.reviewText: Great Location, Friendly staff, Pet Friendly and all at a really affordable price.

review.title: Nice Hotel...Small Room
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, but our room was very tiny. The bathroom was almost as large as the bedroom area.

review.title: Very friendly staff. A little rough around edges
review.reviewText: I was expecting great things from the reviews I'd read but it was just ok. Nice rooms but bath tubs didn't even fit me and I'm 5 foot. Staff a little zealous in their friendliness, but better that way than the other. Lots of things didn't quite work and when I brought it to their attention they fixed it and we're apologetic but it was a stress to wait around for stuff that shoud've been checked prior to my arrival. Massage from hotel manager was GREAT. Spa was a real benefit. Food was mediocre. Main areas could do with a face lift.
review.positiveRemarks: Its not 5 star but the staff are very enthusiastic. Got a great massage by spa manager.
review.negativeRemarks: Being put in a room overlooking the dumpsters.
review.locationRemarks: Close to union square. A little shabby. Kept being approached by people asking for money or cigarettes.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: loved the coffee in the morning, and the different water available in the lobby, thank you.

review.title: Worth the money
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a central location with good rooms for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: The perfect splurge!
review.reviewText: We stayed for two nights and had a wonderful experience. The front desk staff were very helpful in addressing our questions about local restaurants and sights. The booklet they gave us for the top dining, shopping, and experiences in the city was clutch, I highly recommend that anyone visiting grabs a copy. The spa facility was small but we loved the "Turkish bath". I would definitely stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: Plush room, spa, bar & restaurant, location
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Very central, right off Union Square, we were able to walk everywhere from the hotel and felt safe at night.

review.title: Great Hotel!!
review.reviewText:
Love Hotel Monaco. Late night room service, not so much. The manager was very apologetic and removed the tab from our bill immediately.
Nice large bathrooms, very clean, high end linens were much appreciated.
review.negativeRemarks: Late night room service

review.title: Hotel Monaco San Francisco does not disappoint!
review.reviewText: The Hotel Monaco was an amazing hotel that far exceeded my expectations. My room was beautifully appointed and extremely well kept and clean. The Hotel Monaco staff are all very friendly, but I must point out Vanessa at the front desk. She is the reason I would come back to the hotel. AMAZING customer service. Two thumbs up for this hotel. I will definitely be returning the Hotel Monaco on my next trip to San Francisco. Stay at this hotel, you will not be disappointed.
review.positiveRemarks: Vanessa at the front desk is an amazing person and one of the main reasons I will return to this hotel. Her level of customer service is stellar!
review.locationRemarks: The Hotel Monaco is ideally situated near Union Square. The area is walkable and close to many great restaurants and shops.

review.title: Quirky boutique hotel with wonderful ambiance
review.reviewText: Quirky decor, but a warm, friendly and centrally located place to stay in San Francisco. The staff is extraordinarily pleasant and helpful.

review.title: January 14h stay
review.reviewText: We were charged $100.00 for less than 24 hour parking. The attendant told us it was $50/day and when I called the question the charge, I was sent to voice mail in the finance office and have yet to receive a return call (it's been 4 days). The charge has not been corrected

review.title: 25th Wedding Anniversary
review.reviewText: My wife & I were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and we couldn't have a better hotel!

review.title: Everything better than expected
review.reviewText: The room was a little small but well appointed. Staff was outstanding and we enjoyed the free wine tasting whenever we could. The location was convenient to the cable cars and Union Square.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Recommend anyone interested in staying in Union Square stay at the Hotel Monaco. Actually any of the Kimpton hotels are extremely good.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Great Pet Friendly Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Great hotel, love that it is 'pet friendly' but if you didn't bring you pet with you make sure to ask for a non-pet floor. Location is ideal if you want to visit Union Square, loads of great restaurants and car rental locations within walking distance. I'll go back for sure!

review.title: Chic and cozy
review.reviewText: This hotel is only 2 blocks from Union Square, can not be more convenient than that. About 5 to 7 blocks to Bart and Muni. Beautifully decorated, I specially appreciated the area where they serve tea, coffee, hot chocolate with the choice of New York Times and Wall Street Journal in the morning and cocktail hour in the evening. The staff was pleasant and efficient. It was fast to check in and out. The room was cozy especially I liked the big full length mirror in front of the very comfortable bed. It had everything that 5 star hotels have except the view. It faced another building. At least it was quiet at night. For the price you can not beat it. I will probably stay there again sometime.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was super cute, very clean and staff was beyond friendly and helpful. We went for our anniversary and were upgraded to a junior sweet from a queen canopy for free, and there was a note and bottle of wine in our room. Free wine hour was great too. Overall, very happy - LOVE Kimpton hotels!

review.title: good
review.reviewText: It is very close to the Union Square. So it is a good choice for you if you want to go sightseeing in San Francisco.

review.title: It was nice
review.reviewText: We chose to stay here because we always have great experiences with Kimptons and this hotel lived up to our expectations! There are a ton of restaurants within walking distance and it's close to the Powell St. Bart station. The front desk recommended we try Honey Honey (restaurant one block away) for breakfast and we absolutely loved it! We went three times in one weekend. We had a small room compared to other Kimptons we've visited but when you're in SF you're rarely in your room anyway. great wine hour and coffee hour - I would definitely recommend this hotel!

review.title: room without a view
review.reviewText:
the hotel was great. sadly there was another hotel that backed onto ours that was another few floors higher. this meant we had no view and it made our room darker.
the bottled water was $5 and it cost $1 to connect to a toll free number. this is pretty extortionet when you realise you can buy the same water for $1.50 right opposite in walgreens and make my toll free call from a call box
review.locationRemarks: all of it was fantastic

review.title: Excellent Choice - will stay here again
review.reviewText: This hotel was an excellent choice; great location; very nice service. Hotel has a lot of character and we will definitely stay here again. The wine reception and masseuse were great! Free wi-fi was nice. Hotel was also very pet friendly - you couldn't even tell that pets were staying there. The maintenance was impressive!
review.locationRemarks: You cant go wrong with the Union Square area in San Francisco- very convenient to all the tourist places/restaurants etc.

review.title: Will come back
review.reviewText: Great trip. everyone and everything - wonderful.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel

review.title: Clean and accessible
review.reviewText:
The service is impecable from the doorman, to valet, to bell boy and to front desk and concierge.

The housekeeping department is very helpful.

The room is small compare to other North American standard hotel. 4 people will be a challenge. Even two is a bit hard.

However, the hotel room is very clean and well maintained.

It is right in the downtown SFrancisco and extremely close to all visitor/tourist spot.

The parking is very expensive however. $ 50.00 plus tax per night.

Overall, an excellent hotel, and pet friendly.

review.title: Lived up to expectations
review.reviewText: Very friendly, knowledgable and helpful staff. Good location. Met all my expectation.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. We were traveling with our elderly parents and they enjoyed but did suggest that a comfortable setting chair s/b added to each room. 9/28-9/30/2011

review.title: Fabulous BD celebration @ a lovely hotel
review.reviewText:
I usually go sleek and modern but this was a charming departure... funky and unique. Loved the size of the Hotel. Boutiquey feel about it. The staff is very professional and quietly present.

So many nice little surprises during our stay. I was celebrating my BD and my room was upgraded. (I was very happy since the rooms seem on the small side) Wine hour was a fun respite after a full day of enjoying the city.

If you enjoy hotels with personality, quiet luxury and no pretense- STAY HERE! We really enjoyed it.

review.title: A great find
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location just a couple of minutes off Union Square. Our room was on main street but very comfortable and quiet. We stayed for a week and enjoyed good service, wine tasting etc. My wife and I loved our stay in San Francisco, and, the hotel played a big part in our holiday. Plenty of bars, restaurants and shopping easy to get to.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed here on our honeymoon and had a great experience! Rooms were great, very modern and comfortable, yes a tad small but for the city I believe they were quite a good size. The neighborhood can be a bit sketchy a night, but we never felt threatened, just a little annoyed, however it is no different then what you would find in any other city. I definitely recommend!

review.title: Not spacey
review.reviewText: Room too small

review.title: Small but good
review.reviewText:
Loved the look of the room as it was not your typical hotel decor, however, from a practical matter it was very small. Also, aside from the small closet, there was no where to put our clothes, which I found odd. No dresser. Only an armoire that housed the tv & mini bar that had one small drawer. My last gripe about the room was that the bathroom did not have a fan so after a shower it stayed steamed up for an hour.
Aside from the disappointment in the room's functionality, we enjoyed the hotel. Loved the coffee every morning. Missed the afternoon wine however.

review.title: Good for stay
review.reviewText: Great location, hotel is good only

review.title: Not sure if I would pay full price
review.reviewText: We just returned from our San Francisco vacation and we were well rested due to the comfort of our beds! I did find the carpets in our room and the hallways had quite a few spots. I did find out that we were on the "dog" floor (yes, the hotel is pet friendly!) so maybe that was the reason but those things should be attended to. We were mainly interested in shopping so this location was wonderful! We could walk to Union Square and surrounding blocks for shopping and meals. However, we had to be very cognizant of our location because one could end up in a seedy area quickly. Also, I found there were many more beggars on the streets of Union Square day and night. Expedia's deal was wonderful and everything went off without a hitch...thanks!

review.title: SAN FRANCISCO JEWEL
review.reviewText: Fantasic hotel in a great location. Evening wine tasting was an added plus!

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the beautiful Monaco Hotel. The decor was vibrant, the rooms luxurious, the staff brillant and the overall experience was great. Well located close to all the downtown amenities and transport routes it was easy to get around. The wine reception in the evening was relaxed and welcoming. We would recommend the Monaco to anyone wanting a memorable stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Fun Decor, Great Location
review.reviewText: Cute place. Friendly staff. Been there a couple times now, will return for sure.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Very enjoyable time at this beautiful hotel. It is comfortable and quiet...I was traveling alone and felt very safe. The hotel restaurant did not open until 8 am on the weekends so order room service if you are leaving early. The hotel lounge/bar is nice if you are traveling alone...friendly atmosphere! I am ready to go back!

review.title: if you have pets...
review.reviewText: the experience was a firm ok. i don't really value 'posh' the way it was presented, so the expense was not rewarded by the benefit. The hotel offers lots of pet extras though, which would be great if you have a dog that enjoys seeing San Francisco. I stayed at a Kimpton in Seattle that let me have a goldfish for the stay which was kind.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: The room was nice, the wine and orange water appreciated, and the friendly and very helpful staff exceptional.

review.title: Mostly fine
review.reviewText: Like the hotel. The room was a small, dark, but all else was just fine.

review.title: A gem!!
review.reviewText: Beautiful boutique hotel close to Union Square and an easy walk to the Powell St BART. Staff most professional and friendly, and so many little touches like the chilled water and refreshing drinks in the lobby. Great decor.

review.title: Loved Monaco
review.reviewText: Great hotel

review.title: Very good and convenient locaion
review.reviewText: i likes it very much

review.title: First Time in San Fran
review.reviewText: We traveled to San Fran for our honeymoon, and chose to stay in the Hotel Monaco. The hotel is lovely, and looks much more upscale than others we saw while walking around the union square area. Everyone at the hotel is nice and attentive. They greeted us every time we walked into the hotel and even went as far as to remember our names. Also, they have a complementary wine hour each night where guests can mingle, get a massage, and even play wii if they want. The concierge helped us book a wine tour, and all we had to do was tell him our room number and he set the whole thing up. Also, they gave us plenty of good restaurant recommendations during our stay. The only negative was that the beds were a little firm and by the 3rd night my back was hurting when I woke up each morning. Other than that we had a fantastic stay, and to top it all off they upgraded our room and delivered a bottle of champagne for the first night of our stay. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Monaco for anyone looking for a classy, clean hotel in San Fran.

review.title: Totally satisfied :-)
review.reviewText:
My partner and I had such a nice time at the Hotel Monaco in San Francisco. The staff makes you feel more than welcome and is always happy to help you. The design of the hotel is splendid, our room was very comfortable and the location of the hotel is perfect, right next to the Square Union in SF. We enjoyed our complimentary coffee, tea and newspapers in the morning as well as a nice glass of wine in the evening.

We will definitely recommend the Hotel Monaco to anyone who is planning to stay in SF! Thank you to all the staff at the Hotel Monaco for making our stay so wonderful! :-))

review.title: Good Hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: The overall experience at Hotel Monaco was good. The location of the hotel is about 2-3 blocks away from Union Square. The only issue that I was not aware of was the large number of vagrant people that occupy the streets in this area. This seems to be a reoccurring theme throughout San Francisco. The hotel decor is exceptional. I also liked how the hotel front desk staff were able to keep their dogs behind the desk with them. I am a dog lover and seeing the dogs in the hotel made me think of my own dogs at home. I did like the free wifi that Kimpton provides in the hotel rooms. This was my first stay at a Kimpton property, and I will look at other properties by Kimptom for future travel. Overall I liked the property and would consider it for a future return to San Francisco.

review.title: Gotta Love the Monaco
review.reviewText:
It's a boutique hotel, which means the rooms are small but have cool contrasting striped wall paper and carpets. And it explains the animal-skin pattern on the robes. Our bed was comfy.
The public areas are cool, and I liked the free coffee every morning in the back lobby. The location is perfect.
Charging ten bucks for wifi is sooo ten years ago.

review.title: Kimpton hotels are simply the best!
review.reviewText:
My husband & I first stayed at the Hotel Monaco in New Orleans in 2001 for our wedding. We were the first guests, as the hotel just opened and were so impressed with the decor, the prices and the unique-ness of it. Because it was new, we figured tthe superior service and cleanliness of the hotel was due to it's youth! Not so!

We've stayed at Kimptons around the US, the San Francisco location is our favourite. (the damage from the 2005 hurricane caused the New Orleans location to close) We love the daily wine hour in the evenings with the free 15 minute massages and of course the pet friendliness of the hotel. We've never brought our dogs on vacation with us but there's something comforting and home-y about seeing people with their dogs checking in. And we always request the complimentary live goldfish in a bowl for our room during the stay. It may seem a goofy practice but it it's a fun addition.

The eclectic decor is probably my favourite. The Monaco has mastered mixing florals, stripes and animal prints and their art collection (by local artists) is quite impressive. When we got married, we decided to take our wedding photos at the hotel instead of at the wedding site because the hotel Monaco was so much more beautiful! The staff is awesome and very helpful.

I could go on but suffice it to say that whenever we're traveling we see if there's a Kimpton Hotel in the city we're staying. The prices are usually very comparable and for what you get, it's well worth it.

review.title: cant go back
review.reviewText: horiible all around

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is lovely, the room comfortable and the service superb. I needed a wheelchair while visiting San Francisco and asked them to arrange one for me. They actually gave me full use of the hotel wheelchair for the duration of the stay, even outside of the hote.

review.title: FELT LIKE A TRUE GUEST !
review.reviewText:
GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE. VERY NICE ROOM. WE HAD A FANTASTIC STAY.

PET FRIENDLY HOTEL W/ NO EXTRA CHARGE. THEY OFFER THE DOGGIE BOWLS, PET BED, AND FREE PET TOY!

FREE WINE HOUR FROM 5-6PM.

GREAT LOCATION, WALKING DISTANCE TO MANY DELICIOUS RESTAURANTS.

WOULD DEFINITELY STAY AGAIN AND RECOMMEND OTHERS!!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: My parents and I stayed here over Christmas and it was very good. The bed configuration was not good in my elderly parents room and when we requested a new room, the bell boy arrived to show us an alternative. Everyone was very helpful and the hotel is beautiful. The rooms were clean, stylish, and comfortable. The gym and hottub were awesome. The only negative thing I can think of is that the front desk told us the cable car museum was at the end of the line near Fisherman's Warf. It's not and I thought it was a bit odd that they didn't know where a major tourist attraction like this was. Anyway, other than that, everything was perfect!

review.title: Sheek & fab location
review.reviewText: Location is fabulous, walking distance to main plaza, hotels, stores and bus tours. Rooms are sheek and elegant. Service is superb.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The Monaco is a small luxury (I guess) hotel. The lobby is very nice, and the lounge area, with fireplace, coffee in the morning, and wine in the afternoon, is very inviting. The rooms are nice and comfortable, though relatively small, but this is to be expected downtown San Francisco. You don't get a coffee maker in your room (you can request one, but then you have to remember to request that it be serviced every day) but they do provide coffee in the lounge. There's a Walgreens and a small convenience store across the street for any emergency shopping or late night snacks.

review.title: Dingy, lackluster hotel
review.reviewText: Although small and well-located, with a good bar and restaurant in the lobby, the Monaco suffers from a tired look, both in the reception area (small and staffed by one very young and aloof woman) and the room (tiny, with dated decor and an all-around feel of neglect). Then, on each of my two subsequent mornings, housekeeping would incessantly knock on my door to clean up the room (as early as 8:30 a.m. on a Sunday, the day I was checking out anyway). There are far better places to stay in The City.

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Great location. Close to transportation, restaurants and shopping. Staff extremely friendly and helpful.

review.title: Unique Hotel!
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, great bar and wine hr at hotel. comfortable room!

review.title: Great Hotel, Poor Outside Services
review.reviewText: I am a big fan of Kimpton hotels generally and book them whenever I can. I prefer The Prescott and The Monaco in San Francisco. These hotels have desks and other facilities for business, but the rooms are more soft and boutique like. I stayed for about a week this time and the moved on to their hotels in Portland and Seattle. I did have one major problem during my stay. I sent a dress shirt out for laundry and it was seriously burned. At my next travel stop I emailed Kimpton, but they have yet to respond. This is very frustrating because that short cost as much as one night in the hotel and I have never had this experience before.

review.title: Awesome room but poor desk staff & extremely poor room service (ie, never delivered)
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great feel to it, the room & bed were comfortable (although typically small for SF) and the check-in staff were very helpful. However, breakfast room service (ordered primarily to get a jump start on caffeine before business meetings) never arrived. When I called to check on it, I got voicemail. When I double checked upon check out to ensure that I wasn't charged, the clerk was indifferent to the situation and never apologized. She simply stated that the hotel had decided not to charge me since the order was so late, wrongly suggesting that I got something for free.

review.title: Great hotel shame no WiFi
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Monaco is a lovely hotel. The rooms are nice and clean and comfortable.

The Lobby is very grand and you do feel like you are staying in a luxury hotel.

We found a couple of things dissapointing. These were that you don't get free WiFi you need to pay for it unless you are a Kimpton member(??). The parking is also very expensive so would suggest parking round the corner at Best parking . Better still do not bring a car into San Fransisco.

review.title: Enjoyed immensely!
review.reviewText: We couldn't have asked for a better location for seeing theater and shopping. Every staff member was willing to please, courteous and helpful. They really extended themselves offering information and the kind of help we needed with logistics.

review.title: "Do you have any spare change"
review.reviewText: this was my first time in SF and it is a beautiful city, Alcatraz and Ellis island tour was great, great local restaurants and attractions but the relentless beggers,pandhandlers, or whatever you want to call them are really hurting and will continue to hurt atleast the Union Square areas tourist attractions. The harrassment doesn't stop, and it's every 50 feet someone is asking you for money, and they get upset with profanities and such when you say no or just keep walking, it's rediculus that the city officials continue to allow this to happen. I know the POPO has more to do than chase pandhandlers away from tourist but im quite sure tourism is a signifigant contributor to the cities economy. I heard a lot of people saying they would not come back to SF or atleast until this problem is dealt with, i believe everyone has a breaking point and i was close to mine, luckily i was only there for 2 days. Yes i will go back again as i loved the city but i will go back with a more sturn attitude towards this harrassment and have a great time.

review.title: very good stay, would go back!!!
review.reviewText:
Very goo stay
The staff was very nice, ready to help anytime, giving advices on good places to eat.
Very good hotel location. I know several hotels in this area and this one is great. I am usually picky with hotels and location because I want to stay at places that are safe for women travelling by themselves.
Really nice room with unique furniture that make you feel like you are not in a chain.
The free hour wine tasting was great, in this nice room with couches and a fire place, allowing to meet other people staying at the hotel. There was also little running maps available, and I used them, I ran from the hotel.
Really nice hot tub/ sauna/hamman area, I did not try the massages but hey have in romm massages. Did not try the fitness room either but it is a real one, not a small room with 2 crappy pieces of equipment. Very nice café inside the hotel. The only point is that they only had free coffe in the morning but thats really minor compared to all the facilities.

review.title: A great place to stay in SFO.
review.reviewText: The staff was attentive and helpful thorughour the stay. They helped us with restaurant directions and reservations. The room was clean and well appointed. The hotel is a short walk to Union Square and BART. We would definately stay here again,

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location, 3 block away from union square. Lots of homeless in the area but what can you expect from a downtown location. Hotel was lovely from it's location, to the lobby and all of the staff. We stayed on the 7th floor so it was quiet. We needed A/C and it did not disappoint, cooling the room perfectly. Bathroom was big and the wild bathrobes were a nice touch. Staff went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect. They made dinner reservations, gave us maps and recommendations for restaurants, Would recommend Honey, honey and Dotties True Blue cafe for breakfast (be prepared for a long wait at Dottie's unless you are in line before they open at 0730, we wait 45 mins but thought it was worth it) and Cheesecake factory anytime. Slanted door (restuarant) at Pier 1 (Farmers Market) was also great. Didn't love the Wayfair (Tyler Florence's pub). So much to do in this area. Great shopping, theatre (saw Wicked and loved it!), restaurants...would definitely stay at Hotel Monaco again.

review.title: Kimpton Hotels won't let you down.
review.reviewText: Fantastic location in the heart of the business district. Centrally located between Golden Gate Park, AT&T Park, Fisherman's Warf/ Pier 39, Coit Tower and more. Good food venues just outside the Hotel as well. This particular Kimpton Hotel was not as nice as the others we have stayed at, however, had a good theme and was clean and accomodating overall. Nightly parking prices were brutal, so we limited our days with a car. One of the two elevators was down during our stay which created some irritating waits. The business center was nice and the overall services were well provided. We look for Kimton Hotels wherever we go and would definately stay here again if we went back to San Fran!

review.title: Union Square jewel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The hotel is lovely, and the location perfect. We did have a few gliches with the internet, window, et, but how the staff handled them was perfection. They are friendly, accomodating and make the stay special. The coffee in the morning is a treat as is the wine reception in early evening. The lobby is beautiful with big windows, and lots of color.
The location couldn't be better, you can walk to everything. We we definitely return.

review.title: Pet friendly, super comfortable, soooo quiet
review.reviewText: My son and I stayed 4 days while we looked for an apartment. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. Professional and yet not stuffy :) Our room was very clean, very comfortable and very quiet. Although I did not bring my small dog, being pet friendly is so important to me.

review.title: Great location and amenities!
review.reviewText: This hotel was centrally located with nice extras, including the coffee/tea bar in the morning and the wine/social hour, in the evening. Decent workout facility including a steam, sauna and whirlpool. Room though rather small, was nicely appointed. One hicupp checking out, but the manager followed up promptly with an email. Good value that was matched by good service.

review.title: Best Kimpton so far
review.reviewText: This is the third Kimpton Hotel I've stayed in and is the best so far. The Monaco is a beautiful hotel, the room was awesome, staff were great, and there were no problems with the cleanliness. I just wish it could be moved a few blocks further into Union Square as it's too close to the Tenderloin area. I got tired of dodging the homeless panhandlers every time I left the hotel. However, this isn't Kimpton's fault; it's something the city of San Francisco needs to deal with. I booked a larger room which had a king size bed plus a sitting room with a sofa, chair, and TV. This gave us a lot more room and made our stay more pleasant.

review.title: Another wonderful San Francisco weekend
review.reviewText: I am a big fan of Kimpton hotels in general. The Monaco is in a good location. Easy acess to Union Square and the freeway. The only fault I found was one of the elevators was down, so it was slow going from lobby to room.

review.title: Cool Hotel
review.reviewText: Like most of SF, space is a premium. Hotel Monaco makes the best of what it has. The staff is courteous, friendly and willing to go out of their way to assist you. We are not wine drinkers, but the morning coffee, afternoon tea/lemonade and evening wine tastings are a great way to get you out the room and enjoying an experience in an eclectic venue.

review.title: A Great and Inviting Union Sqaure Hotel -- Will Definitely Be Back
review.reviewText: Perfrect location on the periphery of the Union Square area. It felt like we were in a real neighborhood, instead of a tourist-focused site. Everyone we came into contact with were professional, friendly and obviously took a great deal of pride with the property. The hotel is definitely pet-friendly, as evidenced by the gorgeous lab that took up residence behind the check-in desk. The guest receptions were always very well done, and the rooms and property in general were spotless. This was our first visit to San Francisco and we will definetly choose the Hotel Monaco when we return.

review.title: Very impressed!
review.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed in this hotel whilst on our honeymoon and the service we received was nothing short of excellent. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful and went out of their way to ensure our stay was as pleasant as possible.
The room we stayed in wasn't huge but there was still plenty of space. Checking in and out were quicker than anywhere I've ever stayed and although we didn't take one, it was nice to see that if we ever got lonely, we would be given a goldfish!

review.title: Perfect honeymoon experience
review.reviewText: The Monaco staff was very warm and friendly and helped create the perfect atmosphere for our honeymoon! I had let them know that we were staying there as part of our honeymoon previously and they sent up flowers, champagne, and a sweet congratulatory note to our room upon check-in. It really was thrilling and I cannot thank the staff enough for their professionalism and kindness. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a luxurious stay in a fun and inviting atmosphere. They are also pet-friendly which is incredible and they greeted our darling Shih-tzu with open arms! Thanks very much Hotel Monaco!

review.title: Impecable Service
review.reviewText: The staff at Hotel Monaco waited on us hand and foot. It didn't matter what time of day or night we needed something it was at our door in minutes. The Restaurant inside the Hotel was fabulas. I'm from New Orleans and our food is great, but San Fran. could give us a run for our money. Our room was exactly as discribed. Plush, spacious and very comfortable. The spa was avaiable upon request. The Hotel is located in the heart of the city. Most places were in walking distance. Trolly cars were two blocks away and plenty of cabs.

review.title: a beautiful property
review.reviewText: Great Hotel property. A few staff did not seem to be trained or care about customer service, However MOST were excellent.

review.title: Satisfied but room is small
review.reviewText: Rooms are fairly small, and we felt cramped. Wireless works well in the room. Wine hour is pretty good with decent wine. Very close to all the shops in Union Square, and we spent a lot of time in Macys. Decent restaurants close by, and we used "open table" to book. Grand Cafe restaurant in the hotel was not too appealing. Overall a good experience and reasonable price.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Hotel was awesome and conveniently located. Definitely recommend taking a cab at night.

review.title: Will certainly stay here again.
review.reviewText: The staff was great, the rooms were great, the hotel was great and the location was great. What more needs to be said?

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the Hotel Monaco! Stylish, fabulous beds and linens, great location, great pricing. They even changed a queen bed for 2 full beds with no extra charge. Very nice people working at the hotel. Would return in a heartbeat.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: I have stayed at Kimpton Hotels before, and really like them. This was no exception. My treat with this one was the 4 poster bed, complete with full drapes as if this were Elizabethan England. The Wifi set up was really easy and.... it was just a great stay.

review.title: We love the Monaco!
review.reviewText: The Monaco is a great boutique Hotel. Located near Union Square in the heart of the theatre district. the staff are amaazing and really make you feel valued. Love the quirky robes and it is pet friendly. We would definitely stay here again

review.title: did not like it
review.reviewText: Initially, the hotel decor, and the overly ornate furniture in my rather modest sized room, turned me off. But not having hot water for my shower on the morning of an oral argument in the Court of Appeal was pretty awful. So I will neither stay there again, nor recommend it to any one else.

review.title: great boutique hotel with a terrific happy hour
review.reviewText:
rooms were tiny, but well decorated in funky eclectic style. staff was extremely helpful and friendly. indoor jacuzzi was soothing after a day full of sightseeing. five minute walk to public transportation. we also opted to rent a car for a day to see muir woods and napa and picked it up less than 2 blocks away at hotel nikko. happy hour was lovely, offering complimentary wine and sangria and even a terrific massage!
less than 10 minute walk to rue lepic for yummy french dinner and 5 mins. to fino (tasty italian). waited for an hour to have breakfast at dottie's true blue cafe. good but not worth wait. also dined at frascati, and cha cha cha, which were excellent as well.

review.title: Hotel Monaco is simply gorgeous
review.reviewText: It is a home away from home and the staff is very accommodating. They go out of their way to make you feel special. Special thanks for allowing me to check in early after a red eye flight to SF. This was my third time staying there and it will be on my list again.

review.title: July 2010
review.reviewText:
As many others have pointed out. The staff make the difference. Their friendly professional attitude makes you feel like a welcomed friend, too long away.
Extra kudos to Keiko on the front desk.

The rooms are slightly small (normal for downtown San Francisco) but well laid out and tastefully done. I switched to a larger room mid stay and actually found that the smaller room was a better fit for my requirements.

My companion can be an incredibly exacting woman. I was originally berated for not including her in the choosing of the hotel. I have since received an apology for any negative comments and she and I both agree that the hotel will be our base on future trips to the area.

review.title: Good price, good location, great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, much nicer than I expected. The staff was great, very friendly, from the door guy to the manager. Pet friendly is awesome, though you have to walk up hill for about 5 blocks to find grass, but it is a great little park on Nob Hill. The room was a bit small, but hey, its San Fran. Parking was a bit confusing, but there is a garage right around the corner for $40/day, which is cheaper than the hotels price. Several corner stores near by.

review.title: Location and Style
review.reviewText:
As former Bay Area residents we choose Hotel Monaco for its location and style- Decorated beautifully -This is not a VIEW Hotel it's Location Location-Geary St is in the heart of the city- 2 blocks to Union Square.
Rooms are well decorated -3 in our party, one of us had a room the size of a large walk in closet- next visit will ask to see room first--Beautiful public rooms - coffee in am and a DOG FRIENDLY HOTEL- Parking per day very expensive.

review.title: A sweet suprise !
review.reviewText: The Hotel Monaco is 2 short walking blocks from union square and is incredible. From the minute you arrive to the moment you leave the service is great ! Complimentary coffee every morning was wonderful , including teas and hot cocoa! The hotel itself was beautiful inside and the room was exactly like the pictures. Went with my mom and teen daughter and thought the hotel was convient and beautifully decoratedQ! Also there is a Walgreens and a ltitle grocery mart right across the street which we found very nice ! Overall am definately a fan of this hotel!

review.title: Vacation Getaway
review.reviewText: The plane ride to SFO was delayed due to fog in the bay. Once there we were escorted to the hotel Monaco and arrived to great service and a good hub to go sight seeing. The rooms were small but good considering we were gone most of the days there. I would recommend this to anyone. We suggest to fellow travelers if going sight seeing to buy a Muni pass for as long as your stay, it will be worth it.

review.title: Very good experience at the Hotel Monaco
review.reviewText: I would definitely recommend this hotel. Excellent decor and well maintained, a little more walking from this hotel as your base, but worth it. Look at for those parking charges.
