review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was fantastic! Small but clean and nicely decorated rooms. The beds are very comfortablt. The location of the hotel is great. There is easy access to food, shopping, and sight seeing. We would stay at this hotel again!

review.title: Hotel Monaco and Expedia save the day
review.reviewText:
The property we booked on vrbo.com was not at all what we expected. I immediatelt went to Expedia to check out our options. Not only was the Hotel Monaco available for our 5 night stay, expedia offered a discounted price.

The entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was small and comfortable. The free wine from 5-6p was fun and the free chair massage was awesome. I totally enjoyed the fitness center including the steam room and jacuzzi. The food in the cafe was very good.

Our move to a double room when our daughter joined us was seamless.

What a great value, location and hotel!

review.title: Looking forward to stopping in again
review.reviewText: We took a weekend in the city and stayed at Hotel Monaco after dining and drinking all around San Francisco. Staff, check-in/out, valet; all hit high marks as we felt well taken care of. Location was central to most places around the city, and the interior was a far cry from the standard beige and white of most hotels. Beautiful.

review.title: Wonderful boutique hotel in San Francisco's Union Sqaure
review.reviewText: Very nice and friendly staff. Wine and snack reception was a nice relaxing break to the day. Great for shopping but a bit far from the restaurants we wanted to go too. Close to trolley stop.

review.title: Will definitely come back... Excellent Sleep....
review.reviewText: I rarely sleep well when traveling experiencing uncomfortable beds and scratchy sheets... This was a thankful change - I sleep very very well in my comfy, soft bed.

review.title: We will be back
review.reviewText: Great place, great team, great job

review.title: Good, reliable hotel
review.reviewText: We have stayed with Hotel Monaco in several cities and it's always pleasant. Everything you need is there, we love the decor, location, amenities, food and bar.

review.title: Best hotel experience in sf ever!!!!
review.reviewText:
perfect service. everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. they were very nice to our dog, chubbs. doggy biscuits handed out like candy. he had a great time. and no charge for the dog. a++++++ room was very nice. good size for sf (which runs small). elevators were fast. tv and ac rocked. hot water. good water pressure. comfy bed. the neighborhood can seem a little seedy at first but i think it only just seems that way. despite the fair amount of all night "massage" places and typical homeless people and hookers, it seemed pretty safe and calm. i took the dog on many 2-3am walks and nothing weird happened. in fact the people on the street were very friendly. 2 blocks from union square, cable cars, buses, etc. great taqueria on the corner called "el sol". amazing burger place one block away called "pearl's" great neighborhood for cheap eats. tons of local bars within a 2 minute walk.

great experience at the monaco. we won't stay anywhere else in sf from now on.

review.title: Loved the hotel... would stay again!!
review.reviewText:
Excellent two night stay. Arrived at the hotel at 8.30am Sunday morning, and we were able to check in straight away. Major bonus!!
Staff in all areas of the hotel courteous and friendly. Room clean. Bathroom spotless. Free wirless internet works well.

review.title: SF very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The room I was given was laid out a bit awkwardly but it worked ok since I didn't spend too much time in the room. Very clean, helpful staff. Surrounding neighborhood (tenderloin district) a bit sketchy, but I encountered no problems as a woman alone.

review.title: Absolutely fabulous!!--no kidding!!
review.reviewText: We had several recommendations and Hotel Manaco was not among them. We were late in booking a hotel near our desired location and Hotel Manaco offered the best rates. We were so pleasantly surprised by the attentive staff, had a fabulous restaurant recommended that we went to twice, and loved the visit. This is NOT a paid response. We had a wonderful experience at Hotel manaco!!

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel for the money!!!!
review.reviewText: booked the Monaco Hotel from March 9th through March 14th as a Christmas Gift to my girlfriend and to also propose to her. First off, the hotel is amazing!! The staff is super friendly, the food is out of this world and the room was beautiful!! If and when we come back to San Francisco, we will stay here time and again!!! Please, if you are going to San Francisco, you need to stay here!! The Monaco is centrally located to everything in San Francisco and you can walk anywhere in the city. Just a beautiful hotel!!!

review.title: Old style charm in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel stay was great. There was a bit of a hiccup when we first arrived, but nothing major and not enough to put a damper on our trip. Would stay at the Hotel Monaco again!!

review.title: Great time at Hotel Monaco
review.reviewText:
Boutique Hotel - small, clean, polite service, beautiful lobby, nice decor in rooms. During our stay, they served complimentary wine from 4 PM to 6 PM, and complimentary coffee in the morning. There is a beautiful old-fashioned bar located inside the hotel.

The standard rooms are small (300-350 square feet), but average size for San Francisco. We had a queen size bed and a bathroom with a combination bathtub/shower. The view from our room was of a brick wall about 20 feet away. It would have been nice to have a view, but we still enjoyed our stay at Hotel Monaco.

There are many restaurants, bars, and stores within walking distance of the hotel. Parking is expensive in San Francisco, and driving usually takes longer than walking. There is a Walgreens across the street that is open until midnight. You can find many upscale stores at Union Square (about a 5 to 10 minute walk from the hotel). Chinatown is about another 5-10 minute walk past Union Square. Trolley cars run from Union Square to Fisherman's Wharf/Alcatraz for $5.00 per person. Complimentary maps of the neighborhood are available at the front desk.

What I didn't like about San Francisco: 1) There are beggars on every street corner and they are not shy about asking you for money. Just keep walking. I would recommend taking cabs if you are out after midnight. 2) Idiots in Chinatown kept throwing firecrackers at me, but it was Chinese New Year (so maybe that won't happen to you).

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: Great location near Union Square. Very friendly and welcoming staff. Enjoyred the complimentary wine receptions every day at 5pm. A very relaxing place to stay. Apart from a broken toilet which was swiftly repaired no complaints.

review.title: Not a good neighbourhood!
review.reviewText:
The hotel was beautifully decorated but our room was far too small. We had 2 large suitcases and had to climb over them to get around the room. There was a huge cabinet containing the television and given the size of the room a wall mounted tv might have been a better use of the limited space.
The food and drink was very expensive, and not particularly good value for money.
Also, the neighbourhood wasn't good. The first person we encountered when we stepped out of our taxi when arrived at our hotel was a homeless person, persistently begging us for money. This was not unusual and the area surrounding the hotel had several poor homeless people begging on every corner. It wasn't pleasant to sit eating a meal and watching some poor man looking through the rubbish bins for food. On our last day we requested a take away container from the diner and gave our left over food to one of the people on the street.
We were not expecting this from San Francisco, and particularly so close to our hotel.

review.title: A fabulous stay
review.reviewText: The little extras make a difference like tea and coffee at the hotel lobby or the hot chocolate in the afternoons. The friendly, courteous staff were very poffessional. The rooms were excellent.

review.title: Love this hotel !
review.reviewText: I look forward to another stay !!

review.title: Great Experience!
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience! When we checked in, the receptionist found out we were celebrating our 12th wedding anniversary. So when we came back to our room after dinner and dancing there was a bottle of Champagne waiting for us. That was a totally unexpected surprise for us. Our suite was clean, service was good. Will definetly go back again.

review.title: We will return
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel. The room was beautifully decorated. I especially liked the window seat and the huge mioror. I also like it that the hotel is pet friendly. Next time I will bring my Cocker Spaniel.

review.title: San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, Room was nice.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: First, I have to say that the customer service was exemplary. Our only issue at check in was that our room was so small that we didn't know where we were going to store our belongings. The rooms do not have dressers. However, we were upgraded to a larger room without any additional cost to us. The staff are extremely accomodating, friendly and efficient. Once we were switched to a larger room we looked out the window at a view of where all of the dumpsters are located. The view didn't bother me as much as the noise that came from garbage being thrown in the dumpsters in the middle of the night. I will definitely go back to this hotel, but will request a room far away from the dumpsters next time.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Loved everything about this hotel.

review.title: Great, even for a Kimpton!
review.reviewText: I have always enjoyed the level of service at Kimpton Hotels, but the staff at this hotel went above and beyond. When we arrived, it was raining. A bellman removed all our bags from the car and arranged for it to be parked after escorting us with an umbrella into the hotel. It made the check-in process on a cold and rainy day painless.

review.title: Wow this must be first class!!
review.reviewText: This is the place to stay in San Fran

review.title: WONDERFUL Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was WONDERFUL! It was pet-friendly and we met many nice pets and owners. People are much friendlier when there is a pet to help break the ice. We loved the wine tastings and Wii in the evenings. A great way to meet people, their families, and pets.The rooms were very nice and the staff was superb. The location was great. I highly recommend this hotel!

review.title: Fashionable and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText:
My teenagers loved the room decor. Very friendly and professional staff.
We enjoyed complimentary morning coffee/tea and afternoon hot cocoa in the "public living room". Didn't try the wine tasting, but saw many guests were enjoying. Easy walk to/from BART station and Union Square.

review.title: A great alternative to a tower hotel
review.reviewText:
An elegant hotel within easy walking distance of downtown attractions, cable railway and theatres. A longer walk to the convention center but not excessive.
Staff friendly, food excellent. My room smaller than expected but well furnished and very clean. Good value for money for mid December.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: We truly enjoyed our stay from the check in (with the help of Oliver, the hotel dog) to Rex, the companion goldfish that arrived in our hotel room. The room itself was very clean and the evening wine receptions was great.

review.title: Cutiest Suite
review.reviewText:
Got this suite on Expedia for my Birthday..It was sweet!!!
Spacious and affordable. The ONLY down side is the $50 parking. Plenty available parking at alternate lots nearby!!! Will go back...

review.title: SFNov.2009
review.reviewText: Very charming welcome, excellent rooms (decorated with great style); nice "wine happy hour"; generally a very good hotel. The location was very good as well, the only downside was the breakfast: coffea, tea and hot chocolate were provided by te hotel, a muffin / bagel with it would have been nice....

review.title: Friendly helpful staff
review.reviewText: We only spent a single night in the hotel but we found the staff very helpful and the rooms comfortable. The location is convenient. We would stay there again.

review.title: A good choice.
review.reviewText: Our second time back to the Hotel Monaco. Overall an excellent hotel. Good central location but noticed the neighborhood seems to be a bit seedier from the last time. Many panhandlers. Staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. We like the French bistro right in the hotel. Parking is a tad expensive.

review.title: Enjoyed the morning coffee and happy hour.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable. We enjoyed relaxing in the morning and evening with others in front of the fire in the salon.

review.title: 100% Satisfied
review.reviewText: There is not one aspect of this hotel that was not up to par. From the rooms, location, and the wonderful staff I don't have one complaint to give. I would stay at this hotel again without hesitation.

review.title: A decent & clean hotel
review.reviewText: A decent place to stay if you're in town for just one night but I probably wouldn't go back there for a two or three night stay. The room is relatively small and I wasn't a big fan of the decor and furniture but that is just my personal taste so you might think differently about it. Everything was in good shape, clean and functioning at this hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. Again: decent but, at least for me, not the type of place you enthusiastically recommend.

review.title: First Rate Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel gets high marks in all the important "satifaction" categories. The only thing that goes on the negative side of the ledger is that our room did not have a view. We would not hesitate to go back, but we would specifically ask for a room that would give us a view of the street.

review.title: Pretty hotel in a sketchy area
review.reviewText: Love the servie and the room itself, but the area is a little sketchy. That said, it is a short walk to shopping, theatres, etc. and is very comfortable.

review.title: Made work travel easy
review.reviewText:
In my previous visits to San Francisco I have stayed in Union Square however in order to be close to the venue I looked for a hotel in closer proximity to the event I was attending. I have had great experiences with Hotel Monaco in other cities and it was a few blocks from where I need to be so thought I would give it a chance.

The first thing that struck me was the service of the hotel staff. They were all very friendly, extremely accommodating and really went out of their way to make me feel welcome. I have to admit the room was a bit smaller than I expected but it served my needs so I wasn't really bothered. There are potential charges for internet but if you join their loyalty program the internet is free. It was very reliable for my entire stay. The business center was great in that it had 4 computers and 2 printers. I was on limited time to eat and ordered room service and even though they had yet to move into their night menu they made an exception and were able to provide a quick meal to ensure I was ready for the evening. They also have morning coffee in the lobby and have a wine hour hosted by the staff every night.

Just a few blocks away from Union Square there is a Walgreens across the street and a Starbucks one block away. We had to walk back to the hotel at 2:00 a.m. and the brightness of the area left me feeling safe throughout the 3 block walk back to the hotel.

Overall, it was a great stay and I would definitely stay there again in the future.

review.title: San Francisco Gem
review.reviewText: Booked the Hotel based only on the information from Expedia. The Hotel is located central to much of San Franciscos shopping and theater area. The Hotel offers valet parking for $49 a night, but there is a lot on Taylor for $28 200 feet away. The Hotel was excellent, the room was more than expected and the service was great. Be sure and dine at the Grand Cafe attached to the Hotel.

review.title: Convenient location & good quality
review.reviewText: This is the second time I've stayed here. The staff are very helpful, the rooms are nicely appointed & have some real character. It's also well located and convenient to Union Square.

review.title: Elegant hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was elegant, staff was very friendly,very clean stylish rooms. 2 blocks from Union Square which was nice. Would stay there agin.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, nice decor, cozey, nice restaurant and bar.

review.title: awesome service!!
review.reviewText: The place was amazing. Very nice staff and clean hotel. I love the free wine tasting from 5-6 pm everyday of the week!

review.title: Would definitely stay there again.
review.reviewText: Hotel fit our needs perfectly. Loved the size of our room and the bathroom was fabulous.

review.title: Treated like kings....
review.reviewText: Love the free wine hour every day. The staff was soooo nice. Hotel restaurant was lovely (albeit pricey). GREAT location, too, right in the heart of the city. I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Fun hotel with great staff.
review.reviewText: The Monaco is a character hotel and lives up to it's reputation. You will find knowledgeable, effusive staff who are always ready to help. The rooms are, as with many boutique hotels, not large, but ours was not cramped at all and the décor was charming. Food was also good, and the afternoon wine tasting was well attended and fun.

review.title: Staff are outstanding
review.reviewText: Hotel Monaco's staff were fabulous - very helpful and accommodating. Feel of the hotel is upbeat and comfortable at the same time.

review.title: Beautiful, friendly, spacious hotel in SF
review.reviewText: I loved this place. The decor was charming, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff was cheering. The bed was comfortable. For SF, the room was a good size. The in-room music (cd provided) was delightful. Our room the first night stank of cigarette smoke - hence the lower ratings for hotel maintenance - but they moved us out the next day and the rest of the stay was great. I also really liked the Grand Cafe. The physical space is amazing and the food is really good.

review.title: Felt like Home Away from Home
review.reviewText: Location is great, bed was very comfy, I loved the fact that there is a wide window ledge to sit and relax to in the evenings. Great amenities like make up mirror and robes. It was great having a jet spa tub in the room. I enjoyed the wine reception and complementary massages in the evenings. I would stay here again!

review.title: Fantastic Hotel!
review.reviewText: We absolutely loved Hotel Monaco and will stay there on future trips. It is perfectly located and within walking distance to everything. The hotel is beautiful and the staff very accommodating. It is elegant but not "stuffy". The perfect balance between luxury and funky. Their restaurant and bar, The Grand Cafe, was great! We normally never eat in the hotel restaurant, but ate several times in the restaurant's bar. A great, cozy atmosphere, laid back waiters and bartenders and wonderful food. Everything we had - from appetizers to drinks, to sandwiches - was fantastic! We got a great rate from Expedia and stayed in a standard queen room which was comfortable, beautiful, but a little small. We would probably upgrade next time to have a little more space. Couldn't believe we got such a great boutique hotel for the price! Would definitely recommend it!

review.title: A Great Place in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel. It is a beautiful decorated boutique hotel. The staff is welcoming and helpful. The room is nicely decorated and the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever encountered. The room and the bathroom are kept very well and clean. Wine and cheese are offered every evening at 5:30. The hotel is conveniently located within reach of major shopping and China Town. I would most certainly retunr to the hotel when I am back in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The front desk folks are awesome and the location is great.

review.title: Loved our room 'our home away from home'.
review.reviewText: My husband and I absolutely loved our stay at the Hotel Monaco. On first entering the hotel we were greeted by a very friendly young man who guided us into the main lobby. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout our entire 7 day stay. We were upgraded to a larger room, it was available and they thought we would be more comfortable (no extra cost). Our room was beautiful, cosy, quiet and extremely clean. We only went to the spa area for a steam and shower once, but it was very nice. They have happy hour in the lobby from 5 -6 p.m. free wine, games, appy's - we really enjoyed this added feature, met some other travellers as well. The hotel is located close to shopping and a main square area where different events take place throughout the day.

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: I asked not to be put in an area of the hotel where there were not many people since I was traveling alone. I first was assigned a room that was at the end of the hall by the stairs - no one around. So, they changed the room after I complained --then bright lights came into my room at night and I had trouble sleeping. The hotel room was clean but I didn't trust the maintenance people who followed me around all the time. Why??

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Hotel Monaco was a great place to stay while in San Francisco. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful when suggesting places to dine. The hotel is very pretty and clean. The wine reception each evening was much appreciated after a long day touring the city. Highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: This is the Place - Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We could not have picked a better hotel. Had actually gone into this blind, but knew that Kimpton Hotels take the extra step; we knew this was the one. Its location was ideal and the staff were just remarkable. Never once needed to try and figure it out on our on. The staff were more that willing to help out. Beautiful lobby and the rooms somewhat smaller than most people would be use to, the amenities were fabulous.

review.title: Wonderful customer service, lovely aesthetic
review.reviewText: My husband and I were there for 6 days mixing business and pleasure. The staff was amazingly helpful and our room had a lovely interior design that made us feel like we weren't at a cookie-cutter hotel. Highly recommend.

review.title: Kimpton Hotels will always be my first consideration
review.reviewText: Located in the heart of San Francisco, Hotel Monaco offered me great flexibility in walking to the conference I was attending as Moscone Center, the theater, shopping, area parks, shopping and even a Wednesday farmer's market. Public transportation was also easy to access. Additionally, I loved the smallish size of the hotel and the community spirit that was present given the friendly and helpful staff and the evening gatherings that are offered. I also loved the Bill Kimpton memorial that is present in the lobby. What an inspiring man and a leader in social entrepreneurship!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Location, Staff and Service.

review.title: Just Fine
review.reviewText: Hotel Monacos are always great!

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Very nice stay and would go back. Very friendly and attentive service.

review.title: Best Experience
review.reviewText: We had the best experience, not only did we get our room updated to the Suite but the staff was amazing and so welcoming. They had free happy hour which got all the guests together which was nice and when we would come in for a nap they had popsicles offered to us. They went out of their way to make our experience fun.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: I absolutely loved this hotel, and whenever I get back to SFO will definitely stay here again. The staff could not have been nicer, more helpful, friendly and pleasant. Our room was cleaned beautifully, the beds and linens made you feel like you were sleeping on a cloud..everything shined in the bathroom! The complimentary chair massage and wine tasting in the lobby living room every afternoon was such a nice touch. I also loved the decor!! We stayed in a double deluxe room. The location was perfect. Look no further...this is the place!

review.title: Would recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, Great staff, Clean & comfortable room, what more can you ask for.

review.title: Great Place!
review.reviewText: Accommodating staff

review.title: Great style!
review.reviewText: Near sites, helpful staff, clean and stylish rooms

review.title: Grand Hotel
review.reviewText: Pro - Beautiful lobby and common areas Great service personnel Good location Con - Overbooked our queen sized non-smoking room Gave us a 2 double bed room on a smoking floor where room was almost unbearably smoky. All of our clothes even smelled for days. Hotel was able to move us for the 2nd and 3rd night, but gave us the smallest hotel room (and I'm from NYC so I know) on a non-smoking room as a substitution. Expedia was very helpful expediting the exchange, but the hotel evidently didn't feel that any special attention was due with the switch.

review.title: Very Satisfied with our Accomodations
review.reviewText: Liked the hotel. The room was very clean and the service was excellent. The room was quite small which was ok for our stay. The hotel is very stylish - modern decor in the rooms, bell persons wear velvet suits... Had a good experience at Hotel Monaco.

review.title: Good location, nice amenities.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel for reasonable price. Comfortable. Restaurant was convenient with good if not spectacular food.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night and wished we could stay longer. The room was beautifully decorated, very comfortable bathroom and products, a very well stocked mini-bar. Spacious enough for two people and luggage in the Queen room. As others have mentioned, the walls are definitely thin, however because this was so evident to all guest, most spoke quietly, there was no slamming of doors and we slept very well. I'd go back. I would have loved a jacuzzi tub!

review.title: A great hotel at a good price.
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel at a reasonable price. As others have mentioned, the room was pretty small, but it was nicely decorated. The size was not a big issue for me. Anyway, I would highly recommend this hotel. Very Nice!

review.title: Great room Great wine Great location
review.reviewText: When I checked in at the lobby, the very cheerful reception invited me to their complimentary happy hour. It goes on nightly in their charming "living room." The place was packed with world wide travelers. My room was spotless with great Aveda products. The mini-bar fairly priced. Location just a couple of blocks from Union Square. The adjecent "Grand Cafe" is is amazing.

review.title: San Francisco very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very good hotel,great location,will stay again on my next trip.

review.title: No plans to return
review.reviewText: Some good. The staff was all smiles, helpful, and unpretentious. The lobby had a whimsical charm. One major bad. Our room, the queen deluxe, was uncomfortably small, and an unwelcome foreshadowing of the cells on Alcatraz.

review.title: very nice atmosphere.
review.reviewText: Very nice room, excellent service. The staff was very nice and friendly.

review.title: Four Star-First Timer!
review.reviewText: This hotel was the first one that my wife and I stayed in and overall, we couldn't have been happier. The staff was friendly and courteous. The room was just as described, but was starting to show a little bit of age on the moldings and around the wall's wallpaper in the bathroom. The room was adequate, but a bit on the small side and had a view of the side of another building. We went everywhere on Bart and had a great experience with getting around the city! San Francisco is now one of our favorite spots. Thanks Hotel Monaco!

review.title: Perfect shopping spot!
review.reviewText: Surounded by great restaurants and shopping, extremely helpful and delightful staff.

review.title: Great hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely helpful and cheerful. Room was comforatable and quiet with all the amenities we needed. Location was great for a weekend getaway in San Francisco. We will definately stay there again.

review.title: Simply Fabulous!
review.reviewText: We had a fabulous long weekend in the bay area and a wonderful stay at Hotel Monaco. Servivce was impeccable! The room was small but comfortable. We hope to visit again.

review.title: Marvelous Hotel Monaco
review.reviewText: Knowledgeable, helpful and friendly staff coupled with the hotel's prime location contributed to another great San Francisco experience. The staff made you feel welcomed as if you were a regular visitor. My new favorite hotel in San Francisco.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel. The staff is very attentive and helpful. We enjoyed the before dinner wine reception that is offerd free to all guest Located within walking distance to shopping, China Town and Fisherman's Wharf. Would certainly stay here again.

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: was a perfect stay..

review.title: Fabulous Hotel, great location, would highly recommend it
review.reviewText: We truly enjoyed staying at the Monaco Hotel, it was a great experience. Convenient location, the attached Restaurant was very good; great food, nice atmosphere. We would come back anytime!

review.title: Excellent SF hotel
review.reviewText: Ambiance was great, staff was great, the room was clean and comfortable (had one mishap but not hotels fault and was taken care of immediately). The free wine evening was a plus and the Grand Cafe next door was excellent. Also during that weekend I had the pleasure of having Anthony Bourdain (of the Travel show, No Reservations) stay at the hotel so I bumped into him many times in the lobby. This hotel was better then staying at a huge hotel in Union Square. More intimate and private for those that like to stay low key and only a couple minutes walk from Union Square.

review.title: Excellent except the rooms are too small
review.reviewText: Excellent except the room is too small.

review.title: plush and historic comfort- excellent staff-tiny room
review.reviewText: excellent staff- very helpful with sightseeing arrangements, and service-superb dinning and bar- central location, many near by restaurants and shopping traveling alone- tiny- end of hall hotel room- no view but well decorated, comfortable and equipped

review.title: Reliable
review.reviewText: As usual, our stay at the Monaco was pleasant. The staff are courteous & helpful. The lobbby is a delight. The room was comfortable.

review.title: Costly minor items
review.reviewText: The hotel is striking and the staff are friendly and helpful. But I was really surprised at the costs they charged me for what should have been minor items. A small pot of coffee from room service, which was listed on the menu at $8.50 ended up costing over $17. once the various fees and service charges were added. At one point, I used their business center, and they charged something like $6 for fifteen minutes of internet time. Plus, I used the printer to print two pages of black-and-white material. There was a 98-cent charge for that. These types of charges are insulting.

review.title: Wonderful Value
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for an incredibly reasonable price - but it was a real gem. Great location, nice room, albeit a bit small, lovely coffee in the mornings and happy hour around the fire. What really makes this hotel great though are the staff. From the bellman to the doorman to the housekeeper, they were all attentive, courteous, professional and had a sense of pride about where they worked. The concierge even offered me a cookie he had baked earlier in the day! We have stayed at the creme de la creme of hotels around the world and found this charming 4-star..a worthy value for money. I would add that there are better hotels out there if you love luxury, are on business with a good expense account or are on a honeymoon/ planning to stay in your room a lot. But if you just looking for something boutique, charming and within budget, you'd be hard pressed to find something better.

review.title: Great happy hour
review.reviewText: We have stayed here a couple times and the warmth and friendliness of the hotel is what keeps us coming back. Their happy hour is a great way to meet other guests and they always have something extra for you. The standard rooms are very small. But the hotel is within walking distance of Union Square. This past trip there was a lot more homeless outside the hotel and the neighborhood seemed to go downhill since our last visit. However, it is the city and I would still stay there again.

review.title: I love this hotel
review.reviewText: The difference is in the details: helpful staff, free wireless internet access, free (high quality) tea and coffee available all morning, excellent free fitness room, comfortable and well appointed rooms with a safe for valuables, ironing board, and everything else you could need. Large hotel chains still charge for many of these things. Monaco is great for leisure or business travel. The

review.title: Pleasant hotel to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Monaco is a very beautifully decorated and extremely clean hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed the wine reception in the evening before dinner. This hotel is centrally located and is within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf & Chinatown. Many good restaurants close by-eat at Sear's for breakfast (less than a 5 minute walk). Also, Fino's Italian restaurant one street over is a great place for an intimate dinner. Visit the Ferry Bldg @ the Embarcadero and stop by the wine bar for wine tastings.

review.title: Very Inpressed!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very polite and helpful. The five o'clock wine tasting gathering was a nice touch. Rooms very very clean and comfortable. We will defintely be back.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel Monaco is located a couple of blocks off Union Square on Geary St. right by the A.C.T. There are lots of small art galleries in the area which made for a fun afternoon. The service at the hotel was impeccable and like all Kimpton Hotels it has a great funky vibe. The room was on the small side but pretty typical of San Francisco. We had dinner in The Grand Cafe (a french bistro attached to the hotel) and it was quite good...reminded us of our time living in France! The staff even remembered our names and personally greeted us each time we left the hotel. I've never had a bad stay at a Kimpton Hotel! This was no exception.

review.title: Hoped for better...
review.reviewText: We booked the Hotel Monaco after reading several reviews on expedia.ca. Location was very good although the neighbourhood became somewhat "seedy" when heading up Geary instead of down towards Union Square. Our room was quite small and the view was over the garbage bins. Duvet was ripped and not repaired on bed and in middle of night, heating system kicked in and could not be shut off. At 3:30 a.m. it was 88 degrees in our room. When we advised the front desk the next morning they replied that we should have called them to advise of the problem. What would we have done at 3:30 a.m.? Best part about the hotel was the wine hour from 5:00-6:00 in the hotel living room. This was wonderful and a nice way to end your day. Wines were wonderful as well as snacks. Also complimentary 10 minute neck and back massage which was nice touch. We would consider to stay again for this feature but would request a more specific room.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: This hotel is fun, funky colors, canopied bed, nice updates to an older building. Very convenient for Union Square & cable cars, plenty of restaurant choices in the area. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. I wish I'd had time to get the free massage and tarot reading!!

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: I can't recomemnd this hotel highly enough. The hotel itself was luxurious, comfortable, stylish and the customer service was impeccable. Nothing was too much trouble for the excellent hotel staff from the chamber maids to the reception staff who had hints and tips on how to get around the city, recommendations for good restaurants and even recommended a great hairdresser. If I had to fault anything and this is really nit picking now it would be that there is no complimentary coffee or tea facilities in the rooms. I did ask at reception and was told they do not provide them and asked if I would like some hot water and tea bags sent up to my room. What I didn't realise was the cost - $14 - the most expensive cuppa I've ever had in my life! Internet access is also pricey - $6 for just 15 minutes. If you want to stay in the hotel and use email to stay in touch with family and friends - take a lap top, much of my bill at the end of my stay was for internet access. Apart from that a thoroughly enjoyable, memorable stay and if I'm ever in San Francisco again, I'd love to stay there again - as long as I don't order a cup of tea and bring my laptop!

review.title: Cute hotel
review.reviewText: Had a very enjoyable stay - great decor and comfortable room... would definitely go back!

review.title: Happy Hour Haven
review.reviewText: Not only is the Hotel Monaco in the perfect location. It has the best happy hour. They have complimentary chair massages and wine in the sheik lounge area. Pick from Red or White wine and scrumptious little snacks. The last time I came, they had a tarrot card reader. Our room was small but comfy. We really enjoyed our stay. The whole staff was very helpful!

review.title: Central and stylish!
review.reviewText: Cannot recommend this hotel enough, especially for the December festive period. Beautifully decorated entrance and lounge room, awesome rooms and superbly located for Union square and the centre, yet still with easy walking access elsewhere. Walk or get regular transport to Fisherman's Wharf and so on. Very helpful and friendly staff! SUPERB!!!

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: I left a few shirts and a cashiers check in my room. I called back a day later when I realized that I'd left these items. The lost and found had kept my belongings together and planned to ship them back to me, but luckily I was still in town and merely needed to pick them up in a nice and neat bag with a personalized note. Very nice touch!

review.title: Good place, good wine and nice people.
review.reviewText: It's very good experience to apend my X'mas hoilday in this hotel. it's not a very big hotel but I can find most of the things I need. The people there are always helpful and show a warm smile. Worthy to stay if you like a calm but some feeling like home.

review.title: Charming!
review.reviewText: Great mix of classic and modern design, comfortable and clean. Convenient location. The junior suite was perfect for me, thank you for the upgrade. Will definitely stay there again next time.

review.title: Great rooms
review.reviewText: Old style hotel and rooms. Very nice, clean and quiet rooms. A few blocks from Union square. Could get a very good price from Expedia

review.title: perfect stay
review.reviewText: location, service and room could not have been better....especially at the price!

review.title: Excellent service and location
review.reviewText: Staff were excellent and went out of their way to assist us. Hotel is also in a great location only a few blocks from Union Sq. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: very good but needs improvement in housekeeping
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located for Union Square, Moscone center, Embarcadero, other attractions and transportation. The room was very nice with a good bed, pillows and linens. The housekeeping needs better training, which I pointed out to the front desk. The bathtub was not draining and I found a HUGE wad of hair in the drain. A nice feature is that they will print your boarding pass for you while you are out, a very good thing for Southwest passengers for whom timing is important in getting priority boarding.

review.title: Keep coming back
review.reviewText: This was our 3rd stay at the Hotel Monaco and by far the best...the decor, the service, the cleanliness...everything is always spot on. We always try to stay here whenever we feel like having a night in the city.

review.title: Perfect Shopping Location
review.reviewText: Amazing service. A perfect, fancy hotel for hanging out in the City. Staff was so helpful without that "snobby" upper-end hotel attitude. You are about a 5-7 min walk to Union Square and Shopping. About 10 -15 min walk to Cable Cars and Market Street.

review.title: Beautiful, Comfortable Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Had a great week in Downtown San Francisco. The Hotel is not only really beautiful, but has a great french restaurant, beautifully decorated rooms, and the service is excellent. The location near Union Square is unparalleled for good shopping, entertainment and excellent restaurants, in addition to all the other touristic attractions of San Francisco.

review.title: Festive Stay
review.reviewText: Stayed there the weekend after Thanksgiving and was met with festive decor that put us in the Christmas mood. The free wine and nibbles happy hour in the living room pushed the hotel from good to great.

review.title: The highlight of our San Francisco stay
review.reviewText: The Hotel Monaco was an over-the-top experience! It has a very unusual fun, posh, and artsy decorating style. Check out the hotel web site for some examples. We were in a Queen Canopy room and the bed was so elegant and supremely, exceptionally comfortable. All of the staff from check in to check out were genuinely friendly and helpful. The wine tasting was a real treat especially since we didn't know about it so it was a nice surprise. The only drawback was the room was small so not much room for your luggage.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable hotel with beautiful decor and furniture. The wine hour is a nice touch and the conceige had some great recommendations for dinner. The only disappointing element was the card/ key to our room didn't work almost daily to our room and the check in desk didn't seem concerned.

review.title: Good hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is really well decorated and comfortable. Our room was pretty small, but the big window, big mirror and vertical striped walls helped make it cozy. They have a wine hour everyday at 5...that was fun!

review.title: Outstanding hotel in the center of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed with visitors from abroad at the hotel for 2 nights by taking advantage of a great offer. The hotel and staff were outstanding.

review.title: Top class hotel
review.reviewText: We really loved this hotel and appreciated the comfort and quiet offered. I read all the reviews before booking and was not disappointed. It was scrupulously clean and the staff friendly and helpful. The location is great, overall one to be recommended.

review.title: Outstanding front desk staff
review.reviewText: Excellent location and outstanding service. Concierge and front desk staff were especially helpful with suggestions on theatre, restaurants etc.

review.title: Hotel Monaco - a Kimpton Hotel - San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was great overall...great location...neat atmosphere. However, the rooms are a bit small and there weren't enough lights in the room. Everything else was great!

review.title: Everything was perfect! 10/10
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel with great staff. Everyone is helpful and wants your stay to be remembered. The staff were helpful in giving directions and advice. I would hight recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: One to go back to
review.reviewText: Great location for all downtown attractions and ease of access to travel hubs. Excellent service from staff (reception & concierge). We don't usually eat in hotel restaurants but adjacent Cafe served good value and flavoursome dishes, which were innovative twists of traditional French classics using organic and local ingredients.The white truffle fries were awesome!

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: We stayed there with our 2 year old and 8 month old. They were all so nice and helpful. We had a crib waiting in the room for us. The rooms were like a fairy tale! It was like staying at home, not a Hotel. The down comforters and big oversize pillows made it so cozy. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: By far my favorite Hotel In San Francisco. Clean, nice rooms, Good food, Wine tasting, and great location.

review.title: Funky, comfortable stay
review.reviewText: I enjoy the Kimpton family of hotels, because they are fun, comfortble and funky. I recommend for work and pleasure.

review.title: Nice one
review.reviewText: Comfy, we appreciated getting a quiet room as requested through Expedia. For the rate we got, it was excellent quality. Room quite dark but generally we were very happy and great location.

review.title: Top class - role on my next trip
review.reviewText: Everyone from cleaners to manager all so genuine, happy and helpfull. Truly a gem in todays current market of hotels. Location is great to as it is only 2 blocks from the cable cars. We can't wait to visit the Monaco again.

review.title: Great location highly recommended.
review.reviewText: I would stay at this hotel again.

review.title: San Francisco Favorite
review.reviewText: I live about an hour away in Sonoma County and love to stay at Hotel Monaco when visiting SF. It's conveniently located close to shopping in Union Square, many great restaurants, theaters, BART, cable cars... The rooms are gorgeous and the service is superb. The Grand Cafe is a great place to dine or relax in the bar and the room service food has everything you might want.

review.title: Very comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText: We will visit again.

review.title: great deal.
review.reviewText: our room was small and it was located on the second floor close to the grand stairway but surprisingly, it was quiet. it's a great location and the hotel amenities; wine/cheese HH and coffee in the morning are such nice touches. some front desk staff were extremely helpful, a couple were not so accommodating. overall, for the price that we got through expedia, it was a great stay!

review.title: Hotel Monaco rocks
review.reviewText: This boutique hotel has a perfect location. It's close to Union Square, great shops and restaurants. The room is smallish, but well-appointed. The food served by the hotel's restaurant is very good. However, you're in San Francisco, so get out there and try the city's other restaurants as well.

review.title: Excellence!
review.reviewText: Just a fantastic place to stay. Very centrally located. Beautiful interiors. Outstanding restaurant & bar. When staff came across us, they were always so polite & concerned that we were enjoying our stay. Beds are incredibly sumptuous. Only TSK! TSK!: Not having stamps available for those who like to send postcards. But overall, terrific service & ambience!!

review.title: Very nice!
review.reviewText: The room was confortable, quiet and clean and service was great. The restaurant and the ,bar are also very good.

review.title: ROOMS TOO SMALL
review.reviewText: THE HOTEL WAS GREAT AND THE STAFF WERE OUTSTANDING. THEY RECOMMENDED A STEAK PLACE CALLED BOBOQUIVERIA'S THAT WAS THE BEST STEAK I HAVE EVER HAD INCLUDING MORTONS, RUTH CHRIS, HYDE PARK, FLAGLER'S, AND CAPITAL GRILL. IT WAS QUIRKY LITTLE ROMANTIC PLACE WITH A GREAT WINE LIST CHATEAU D'YQUEM BY THE GLASS. THE ROOMS HOWEVER WERE TOO SMALL. I THOUGHT I HAD CHOSEN ONE OF THE BEST ESPECIALLY CONSIDERING THE PRICE BUT APPARENTLY NOT. I THINK I WOULD GO BACK IF ONLY FOR BOBO'S.

review.title: Would love to go back
review.reviewText: This is a lovely hotel, perfectly situated, walking distance from Union Square, China Town, Nob Hill. The service was exeptional, we enjoyed the wine social and just the overall ambience of the hotel.The only drawback was the fact that our room, although very comfortable had a very limited view. Nevertheless we would love to go back and also once again enjoy the excellent cuisine of Hotel Monaco's well regarded Grand Cafe and Petit Cafe.

review.title: Fun hotel room
review.reviewText: Great location, very clean, good restaurant and bar. would definitely go back.

review.title: One of San Francisco Best Hotels
review.reviewText: Recently stayed there for 6 nights, hotel staff were great throughout our stay. Although our Queen Deluxe room wasn't the biggest, it was of a very high standard, the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed that I have ever slept in. We didn't attend the cheese & wine reception, but a "great touch". If I was ever going back to San Francisco, I would definately use this hotel again.

review.title: The best service we received worldwide
review.reviewText: I cannot rate this hotel highly enough. We had a deluxe King room which was just beautiful. Incredible decor and very large. The bed was extremely comfortable. We did a world trip, travelling through Europe and then New York and San Francisco and the service in this hotel was the best we received anywhere. The bell man in particular was really outstanding. I've never experienced such genuine, friendly, helpful service. My only negative comments about the hotel would be that we had room 225 which was right next door to the function room on level 2. On 2nd morning we tried to have a bit of a sleep in but there was some setting up of the function room going on quite early and the clinking of the glasses and plates and cutlery was VERY loud. Also once the people got into the function room, they were extremely loud on their breaks and all milled around our room talking very loudly, so it was impossible to sleep in and very annoying. It wouldn't stop me from staying here again, I'd just request not to be in that particular room! The other negatives were, very dirty windows in our room and not being able to even pay for late checkout when we weren't leaving till 7pm for our late flight back to Australia. I guess this wasn't really their fault as they said they were overbooked on our room type. They also let me use the shower in the day spa downstairs which was actually a really nice shower! I would still recommend this hotel.

review.title: Funky hotel, great location, great service
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay here. All staff were extremely attentive and pleasant. Lovely room: well-furnished, clean, comfortable. Our only complaints were that there were no tea/coffee facilities in the room and that there was only the tiniest wardrobe, so we couldn't unpack our bags and hang things up

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: Had an amazing time at this hotel. The decor is the right side of funky and quirky, the beds are the most comfortable I have stayed in and the wine tasting evenings a bonus. The only fault was we were promised "something sparkly" as were ending our honeymoon trip at the hotel but it did not arrive!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I must say was impressed by the hotel - staff were very friendly, room was huge and was well maintained. Good central location

review.title: Can't say enough about our experience
review.reviewText: I selected this hotel based on location, price, and the reviews I read on Expedia. We were not disappointed. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The service was excellent. We had a lovely and quiet room with queen bed. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate were served in the living room off the lobby each morning until about 11. From 5 to 6 each evening there was a complimentary wine reception where you could also receive a chair massage. We only ate one breakfast at the hotel, but it was excellent. We found a great diner two blocks away where we ate the other mornings. Hotel location was superb, within walking distance of Chinatown, North Beach, Pier 39 and Fisherman's Pier. A wide array of stores was only two blocks away. I would recommend this hotel without reservation.

review.title: Definitely why we left our heart in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Very special place. Location terrific. Bed ultra comfortable and interior design very attractive. For two people, the queen suite and larger is mandatory. Loved having a goldfish in our room. Wine reception every night is lovely. Restaurants terrific. Shower is terrific but gotta say only downside of the whole experience was no bathtub in room....Overall - LOVED IT!

review.title: Very stylish hotel with friendly service and a great location near Union Square.
review.reviewText: Very beautifully renovated older hotel with smaller rooms but all the amenities of a first class hotel incl.dvd player,and excellent sound system from a CD/radio unit with remote speakers in the rooms. Very good restaurant in the hotel if slightly expensive. The hotel also accepts pets.

review.title: Wonderful staff!
review.reviewText: What a wonderful place to stay! As a single female traveler I never once felt unsafe or uncomfortable at this hotel. The staff from the front desk to the room service was spectacular. Great location.

review.title: Unique hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Would definitely stay again. Great location. Staff was friendly, rooms clean, beds comfortable. Different and unique hotel. Close to shopping, restaurants, theaters.

review.title: A Good Choice
review.reviewText: I recently stayed two nights at the Monaco with my wife and two children, and was generally impressed with the hotel. The building is handsome and all of the public rooms (lobbies, restaurants, fireplace sitting room) are elegant and inviting. We booked a "deluxe double" and the beds and room interior were comfy and nice, but our room was quite small. Not so the bathroom, which was large and well-appointed with a mammoth, tiled walk-in shower. Nothing in S.F. is cheap, but breakfast in the main, very plush dining room was exhorbitant. With tip and limited dining choices our tab came to $88 for four. That's a lot for granola and waffles. They have what appears to be a very nice "petite cafe" with wood burning oven that looks good for light eats, though we didn't try. Parking is expensive, $50 a night, though we received a 25% reduction for having a hybrid. A goldfish in a bowl in our room (cute touch) was promised for our young daughter, and somehow it took nearly 1 1/2 days before it was delivered (the hotel has to understand the patience factor when it comes to pets and young kids). That, and too expensive breakfast, and smallish room were the negatives, but overall a very nice, shiny, elegant and well-located hotel.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: Very easy to get to the hotel with BART. Got off at Powell Station and walked a couple of blocks. This hotel is different than any other hotels that we have been to. It is a boutique hotel. The decoration is unique, I took quite a few pictures in the hotel. The concierge and front desk greets you when you pass by every time and is very friendly and helpful. They have free coffee every morning, good coffee too. The rooms are very clean, a bit on the small side (Queen deluxe). The bed is so comfortable, quiet room. Good maintenance. The location is great, close to the cable car stops and MUNI. Close to Macy's at Union Square for the hop-on-hop off double decker bus stop. Close to various restaurants in the area. Starbucks right across the street. The Grand Cafe is supposed to be a well known cafe, didn't get a chance to try it though.

review.title: Small Room but Great Location
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed here for four days and although the room was a little small, it was in an excellent location (Theater District). The staff was superb and tended to our every need including call us by name when they saw us walking in the lobby. A++++

review.title: Will definitely stay again
review.reviewText: We loved it, the staff was so helpful and the restaurant was great.

review.title: Funky, Little Utopia in the Heart of the City
review.reviewText: Great location, fantastic decor. Rooms are small, but very well-designed. Staff was a bit to overeager at times, particularly housekeeping, but the hotel itself was fantastic.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed our week stay at Hotel Monaco. We were very impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms and welcoming staff. The Queen canopy room was a bit small (cozy) but the comfortable/romantic(decor) bed made up for the lack of space.

review.title: MONACO - GREAT HIGH-QUALITY HOTELS
review.reviewText: I've stayed at two Monaco Hotels in the last 30 days. Both were GREAT! This relatively new (at least to me) quality hotel chain has a LOT to offer - great service, free wine-tasting, and top-notch, recently updated property. TRY IT!

review.title: Hotel was beautiful
review.reviewText: Everything was wonderful. Beds were heavenly, we need to buy a comforter and pillows like that for home! Staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Wine reception was pleasant. Parking was the only downfall, but that seems to be common in San Fran. We used valet parking the first night for $49, with full in and out privileges and it worked well. Would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Stylish Monaco!
review.reviewText: My husband and I booked this hotel after having stayed there previously. We also booked a room for our daughter and her fiance, as they were to be married that weekend. The staff were gracious, sending champagne and chocolates to their room, and the stay was wonderful! We will be sure to return!

review.title: A nice hotel for the money.
review.reviewText: Rooms are nicely appointed. Bath products are excellent. Noise level was minimal. No view from windows. Good value.

review.title: Outstanding Experience
review.reviewText: From the doorman upon arrival to the concierge and doorman upon departure a truly memorable experience.

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Great hotel overall. Very unique rooms and hotel decor. Comfy bed. Only drawback is room very small.

review.title: very clean, comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: The toilet kept getting clogged. One night the staff came to plunge the toilet...and then the same staff delivered our room service. It was disconcerting. I do have to say that the staff was very professional and nice, it just was not really all that appetizing. The room service food after hours is not worth the price. Food cold, soggy and disgusting. Bill S90.00 for a burger and fries for 2 with one piece of cake. The Grand Cafe was Fantastic next door.

review.title: A gem, really nice people
review.reviewText: The decor and architecture inside are quite elegant and parking is convenient. But the people make the difference and we have never had such pleasant and efficient help.

review.title: you must stay here!
review.reviewText: Best value in SF, Union Square. Will definitely stay again.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: The hotel is really nice. The location is great and the staff is friendly. Only wish the room was a little bigger.

review.title: Nice Hotel/Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel Monaco was a great hotel. The food in the restaurant was really good but just a tad expensive. The service was great and the rooms were really nice. All in all a nice hotel.

review.title: Great small hotel near Union Square in San Francisco
review.reviewText: If you want to stay near Union Square, but not pay out the nose for a room, I recommend this hotel. I have stayed at others in the city and paid a lot more and did not have the quality of service and attention to detail. The room was quiet, and the bed was wonderful. The hotel is near many eating places that serve some of the best meals in the city. And by the way be sure and eat at the hotel. The food is excellent. It is 2 blocks from Union Square and the cable cars, and 6 blocks from China town. Take the cable car to fishermans warf and to the Ferry Building on California for wonderful food and shopping

review.title: Simply the best
review.reviewText: Casual luxury-two massive gas fireplaces and huge public rooms-more like gathering room for wine and cheese happy hour-staff was always prompt and ready to assist with everything-offered to print out our airline passes-complimentary neck/back massages-room was spotless daily-we stayed a week-excellent linens and soaps/lotions-we saw many other hotel lobbies downtown/Union Square but this was the warmest and most inviting-excellent location up the street from Union Sqare-looking to trying out Portland, Oregon hotel-a top choice for a hoenymoon, anniversary, etc.

review.title: Fun decor and wine receptions
review.reviewText: We recently spent a couple of weeks at the Hotel Monaco and were quite pleased with our room, our goldfish, and the wallpaper! Loved the wine and cheese receptions and the massages. The doormen were most helpful. Based on the web site, We didn't know that the business center charged for computer use. Otherwise, we enjoyed ourselves.

review.title: Felt like sleeping under the big top
review.reviewText: Staff not quick to get back to you when you ask them a question. We received our reservation # for dinner the morning after!

review.title: Great Hotel and Service, but Internet Access Lacking
review.reviewText: Hotel Monaco's wireless internet service was very slow and it was difficult to obtain a free account to use the internet from my room. Connectivity improved with the supplied ethernet cable, but the speed was a bit slow. But Hotel Monaco was a great place to stay and I received a really good rate through Expedia!

review.title: Monaco has x factor - something extra on most hotels
review.reviewText: Abolutely loved my three-day stay at the Monaco - room was romantic, service friendly and helpful, wine and cheese in the evening gave a welcoming atmosphere and I met some great people and had a relaxing massage. Read the story about Mr Kimpton and realise he was the reason for the hotel being so special.

review.title: An Absolutely Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: We just returned from a weeks stay at the Monaco. It is a small hotel, with gigantic service. The staff is exceptionally friendly, and seemed to care about our every need. The the hotel decor is beautiful. Rooms were clean and classy. We were extremely pleased with our stay and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. One word... get a double room or a suite, or ask about room size first as some are a bit small. We had a deluxe double and it was big enough, but only for two. Beds were outstanding!!!!

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The room was on the small side. Upscale Frette bed linens. Smallish, boutique type hotel. Helpful, attentive staff. Spacious bath considering size of rooms. Our rooms at back of hotel on 6th floor were very quiet. Overall, a good pick. Nice workout room with sauna, large jacuzzi. We were very happy with the experience.

review.title: Best Hotel In San Fransisco
review.reviewText: The minute I walked in to the Hotel Monaco, I was extremely impressed. I have never heard of "Kimpton Hotels" before staying at this one, and I would definitely do it again. The area is great, right on GEARY Street and by Union Square. Shopping and Restaurants are plentiful, and Chinatown a few blacks down. This hotel was a guess for us, but i am happy that we stayed there. The rooms are so beautiful, and CLEAN. The Hotel Monaco is SO worth it!

review.title: Best Hotel In San Fransisco
review.reviewText: The minute I walked in to the Hotel Monaco, I was extremely impressed. I have never heard of "Kimpton Hotels" before staying at this one, and I would definitely do it again. The area is great, right on GEARY Street and by Union Square. Shopping and Restaurants are plentiful, and Chinatown a few blacks down. This hotel was a guess for us, but i am happy that we stayed there. The rooms are so beautiful, and CLEAN. The Hotel Monaco is SO worth it!

review.title: Not a bad hotel
review.reviewText: Not a bad one. small room but well equip. friendly stuff

review.title: Very nice stay at Hotel Monaco
review.reviewText: I had a really enjoyable stay at the Hotel Monaco. The hotel is lovely, the people very nice, everything is very calm and professional. I had a double room that was decent sized, the bathroom was also a good size. The room and bathroom were very pretty and extremely clean. The beds were very comfortable. A lot of nice amenities, including free wifi. (Even the IT guy on the phone who helped me with a connection problem was nice and helpful!) Overall, this was an extremely pleasant experience and I recommend the hotel highly for a stay in SF.

review.title: Cant wait to go back.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Friendly staff. Nice location very close to Union Square. Allowed easy access to the whole city from this central location.

review.title: A wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: Never heard of Kimpton before, but if this is a typical example, I'd look for them in the future. Hotel is in a central location, making it easy to get around to all parts of San Francisco by public transit. After returning home, I priced the room we had on-line for curiosity because it was done originally as part of a package. The package was certainly a great value. Doorman actually knew us by name, and was great at giving directions. Room made up quickly each day while we were out. Fabulous (but pricy) restaurant. I'd stay here again.

review.title: Small, but Comfortable
review.reviewText: The Hotel staff was great and the Hotel was clean and comfortable. The room was rather small. It reminded me of those in Europe. The bed and shower were great!

review.title: The best hotel experience in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My daughter and I really enjoyed the experience and service provided at Hotel Monaco. The service was excellent and the hotel met all our expectations. The decor adds to the San Francisco experience.

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: Good value for the cost. Very comfortable, quiet and clean. Will return there when I need a place to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Loved the hotel - it was fun & in a great location
review.reviewText: We took a mini vacation with the kids to SF and found the Hotel Monaco a perfect getaway. The decor was fun and the kids loved having a goldfish as their very own pet during the stay. Fitness center was very nice - which was a treat. The restaurant was a great choice for breakfast - service was a bit grumpy- but the meal was fabulous.

review.title: Quite nice
review.reviewText: Nice furnishings, very clean, good staff attitude. Fun wine tasting and complimentary massage. Location is great.

review.title: Very funky
review.reviewText: The hotel is a very funky, eclectic mix of decor and design. The staff is incredibly warm and friendly, especially the cleaning staff. Everyone always had a huge smile on their face. We had a queen size room and it was on the smaller side, but the bed was extremely comfortable and the Kimpton hotels are always great for thinking of small details such as books for reading etc. I read one review by a person who felt the hotel was not well situated in that if you went a couple of blocks the wrong way you were in a bad area of town. I don't know what kind of sheltered world that person lives in, but I found all areas to be safe, full of people, and fun to explore. Highly recommend it.

review.title: Best San Francisco Hotel that I have stayed in yet!
review.reviewText: The Monoco in San Francisco is a fantastic hotel. The staff is exceptional, the rooms are the cleanest I have seen anywhere, AND it was quiet! There are several hotels in SF with a better view, but most that I have stayed in are very noisy throughout the night. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a warm and welcoming friendly staff, an interesting and inviting decor, exceptionally clean, comforatable quiet rooms, and a great experience. I plan on staying there every time I visit SF!

review.title: A real treat. They've thought of everything.
review.reviewText: This hotel was just what I needed after stepping off a long haul flight. From the moment you arrive the staff take care of you and you feel instantly relaxed. The room has everything you could want and being able to plug your own ipod into the radio/alarm clock made me feel instantly as if I was staying at a friend's house rather than a hotel. Wish I could have stayed longer.

review.title: I stayed for for 9 nights! Great 4 start HOTEL w/out snobby service!
review.reviewText: The benefits of this wonderful hotel, its friendly (not stuck up for a 4 star) accomodating staff, fantastic resturaunt and petite cafe, free wireless(easy!) , free wine hour and its great location for business and leisure travelers cannot be overstated..... AND THEY TAKE PETS! and it has delicious well priced mini bar... I loved the hotel and it was super clean and the location is wonderful...I live in SF and stayed there while my house was being painted and some minor remodeling. My only complaint was my hotel wireless phone was broken. I took three requests of front desk (wonderful friendly staff) to get it fixed. Then engineer came and supposedly fixed but it still didn't work..so I talked on the phone in the bathroom....not the end of the world- we all use our cellular phones anyway....

review.title: great hotel, very clean and great style,loved the grand caffe
review.reviewText: Great hotel, very clean, beautiful style. I loved the grand cafe.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great price, room was very comfortable, and the staff was extremely nice and helpful.

review.title: Good **** Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a lovely time. No complaints.

review.title: Made the perfect aniversary getaway
review.reviewText: My wife and I were looking for a nice hotel to stay at for our second anniversary; the Hotel Monaco was better than we could've hoped for. We booked the hotel because ***according to Expedia*** the double room had a jetted tub. So I booked the room only to find out when we got there that the double room has only a standard tub. I went down to the front desk, informed them of the mix-up, showed them the mistake on Expedia and told them that the jetted tub was why we chose this particular hotel for our anniversary. They immediately gave us a suite and a bottle of champagne was delivered to our room because it was our anniversary. They really made it a special evening. Thanks Hotel Monaco! If I could give their customer service 7 stars I would.

review.title: Great place, but only with a deal
review.reviewText: I got a very good price from Expedia, much less than the usual rate at this hotel. The decor of the hotel is a bit flamboyant with bold colors and decorations, a bit like walking into a fairytale. It certainly isn't decorated like an old-school luxury or neutral-colored business hotel. My room was on the corner of Geary and Taylor, but there wasn't a noise problem. Nice bed, linens, bath (I had a large shower and a jacuzzi tub), and toiletries. The common areas were also nice. They have wine and cheese in the early evening, if that's your thing (the wine is mediocre, so...). It's well located near A.C.T.'s theater and only 2 blocks from Union Square (Powell and Geary). The area to the east begins to go seamy in a couple blocks, but it's fine right at the hotel and toward Union Square.

review.title: Home away from Home
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived the staff was all smiles and extremely helpful. The concierge service was impeccable and the decor was fabulous. There was a dog behind the counter in a smoking jacket and a tie.. how cute. The rooms were extremely comfortable and imaculate. No details were missed in the room-including animal print robes and lingirie options. The room service was above expectation and I wouldnt stay anywhere else in San Fran. The location to the cable cars is perfect. It was quite and no street noise could be heard. The wine and cheese receptions every evening were spectacular. Don't miss the complimentary aromatherapy spa. It's to die for. Honestly, I can't think of one bad thing to say, and I'm quite picky about my hotel experiences. I can't wait to go back.

review.title: charming coziness
review.reviewText: really enjoyed the Grand Cafe Brasserie. You will die an incomplete death without trying the Banana Cream Pie. Rooms were tiny but snug.Staff very accommodating and friendly,great lobby fireplace.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Central location, however walking west on Geary leads into a seedier area of the city. Union square and public transit were blocks away. The restaurants, galleries and theatres on the same street as the hotel were wonderful. It was a great home base to see San Francisco from. The hotel was luxurious and the food in the hotel restaurants was fantastic.

review.title: Very nice hotel....definitely would recommend!
review.reviewText: We recently stayed in one of the queen canopy bed rooms. The room was very nice and well decorated. It seemed like the hotel thought of every little detail when they furnished the rooms - there was even a CD player with speakers and also an Ipod dock on the clock radio. The hotel in very centrally located to most attactions and close to a trolley stop. I would recommend that you check out the daily wine tasting hour (complimentary) that is located in the hotel "living room". Despite the hotel being oet friendly, it was very clean with no noticable pet odors. They even have goldfish there that you can borrow to be your temporary oet during your stay there. The only bad thing that I should mention about this hotel is that it is located very close to the Tenderloin area (very bad section of town), so I would recommend that you stay on the main street after dark and avoid the side streets.

review.title: very fun hotel
review.reviewText: great hotel

review.title: Must Read before you decide.^^
review.reviewText: My wife and I booked(2days) this hotel because it had a rating of four stars, travelers rating of 4.6 and the picture of the room was very cute. But when we stepped into the hotel, we could tell right away that this was not the one that we were looking for. First of all, carpets of the hall way and the room was very dirty(need serious steam cleaning). Seconly, one of the room chair was worn out(one side) and had stains all over(must be replaced by new one). Finally, one of the pillow cover was okay but the other one was very old and also had little stains. it was a terrible experience and I had to call Expedia.com back and forth to cancel the second night. Front desk offer me another room but I definitely told them to cancel the second night. I knew that room change is not going to do anything because this hotel needs serious inside remodeling.

review.title: Fun, comfy and clean
review.reviewText: This truly is a gem in a great location. The room is a bit small but very comfortable and thoughtfully laid out. We loved walking to shops, the cable car, and restaurants. Room service was prompt and very helpful but I wouldn't eat in the restaurant again. We'll definitely stay here again - it will be our SFO regular.

review.title: Small but beautifully put together
review.reviewText: We ended our three and a half week trip around the US at the Hotel Monaco, San Francisco. This was the third Hotel Monaco we stayed at on the trip, the others being at Portland, Oregon and Seattle, Washington State. We were delighted with all three hotels, the decor and service especially. The one slight disappointment was the size of the room, Although not cramped it wasn't as spacious as the rooms at Portland and Seattle but that might be down to the fact that space is at a premium in San Francisco. Unlike the other two hotels this one had a restaurant attached - The Grand Cafe. After walking the hills around San Francisco it was a joy to be able to dine in such close proximity to our bedroom. The staff were great. I asked at the desk whether I could have any shaving gel as mine had just run out. 30 minutes later the hotel receptionist knocked on my door to apologise for the delay and said that housekeeping had run out so he had been out to a shop to purchase a can. He refused to put it on my bill - that's service.

review.title: Would definitely stay there again & recommend to others
review.reviewText: First visit to San Francisco & chose this hotel based on other reviews...found it to be in an ideal location for exploring the city. Staff friendly & helpful & room very comfortable. No complaints whatsoever!

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: I just returned from a five day time-of-my-life trip from San Francisco where I stayed at the Hotel Monaco. Yes, my room was small and lacking in natural light but I did not spend that many daylight hours there. It was clean and comfortable. I loved the bed and bath linens, the funky fluffy robes as well as the L'Occitane toiletries. From check-in, to concierge services, to the doormen, to the car service for hire, the people at the hotel were friendly and helpful. This is a boutique hotel staffed by down-to-earth people. The hotel is across the street from the theatre, on the opposite corner of a pharmacy, kiddy corner a Starbucks, 2 blocks from Union Square, 6 blocks from Nob Hill and 20 minutes to the airport. I walked everywhere in the day and used the car service to dinner every night. I will return to San Franciso soon and would stay at the Monaco again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Boutique hotel for the down-to-earth
review.reviewText: The people here at the Monaco made my stay worthwhile and repeatable. Check-in was smooth, concierge was ultra helpful, door staff welcoming and accommodating, luggage storage was easy and safe. Everyone is friendly. No one has an attitude. My canopy queen room was small and a bit lacking in natural light but the comfort and cleanliness made up for its shortcomings. The bed and bath linens are high quality and L'Occitane toiletries are amongst my favourite. The plush robes are fun! I love my daily New York Times.
