I stayed here for five days and used the car service outside which was so nice compared to a taxi. Every day I walked and shopped or photographed till I dropped (Union Square is two blocks away). Every night I dined outside the theatre district but the $15 one-way carfare plus $5 tip was worth arriving at the best restaurants in San Francisco - Gary Danko (5-star near Fisherman's Wharf), The Slanted Door (Asian fusion in the Ferry Building), Boulevard (Continental off The Embarcadero) and Delfina's (Italian in the Mission). I have plans to be back soon to retrieve my heart that I left high on a hill.

review.title: Will definitely stay again
review.reviewText: I was very happy with our stay while in San Francisco. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were small, but cute and comfortable. Parking is expensive at $45 a day, so other arrangements will be made next time. A good place to stay in a central location, I will recommend this hotel to others for sure.

review.title: Great atmosphere
review.reviewText: Very cool hotel with courteous an helpful staff!

review.title: Very nice boutique hotel
review.reviewText: We always like to stay in boutique hotels in San Francisco and were not disappointed with Hotel Monaco. The service is outstanding - we really never had to ask for anything. E.g., I walked in with an armful of flowers and immediately was asked if I needed a vase. The flowers were arranged, flowers added, and the arrangement brought immediately to our room. I also treated myself to a facial at the spa and experienced one of the best facials I have ever had. I highly recommend this hotel. It is also in a great location, with plenty to do and eat within walking distance.

review.title: Wonderful!!
review.reviewText: The whole place is absolutely stunning. Staff helpful, rooms spotless. Very central, close to Union Square and the main shopping area. Only gripe would be not being able to see the tv from the bed unless you were perched on one corner of it.

review.title: Great hotel without the snob factor
review.reviewText: The Hotel Monaco San Francisco does a very good job in providing a very inviting, trendy looking, well-appointed, friendly hotel without any sign of arrogance that you might expect from such a place. Whether we were dressed for dinner or walking through the city in flip-flops and shorts, the staff from the front door all the way upstairs to the maid staff were always friendly, helpful, and courteous.

review.title: Charming San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: The Monaco is a totally appealing hotel with a beautiful lobby, lovely gym and a great restaurant. Our room was relatively inexpensive but very small. It was however, very beautifully designed, romantic and had fabulous technology. We would go again but upgrade rooms.

review.title: Great price and great hotel
review.reviewText: Two blocks from Union Square's shopping. Easy walk to lots of attractions. Hotel room was exactly what was pictured on the site. Nothing for me to complain about. Parking was a bit stiff at $45 a night. Hotel is on Geary at Taylor. There is a parking garage just south of Geary on Taylor for $25 overnight parking.

review.title: I Left My Heart in SF
review.reviewText: Loved the canopy bed and unique decor!

review.title: Charming decor and great central location
review.reviewText: Location was great for access to Union Square, BART, cable cars. Quiet at night although our room wasn't facing the street. Liked the afternoon cookies plus complimentary wine at 5:00 although too crowded to sit down. Decor is a little eclectic which we like. Room was a little small but OK. Cafe at the hotel served great food all day. We asked for 2 restaurant recommendations. One was touristy but pretty good food. I wish they would have told us that the cable car goes right there because it was a pricey town car ride. The other recommendation was so inappropriate for us that we left.

review.title: Highly recommend
review.reviewText: The Hotel Monaco is an excellent hotel in an equally excellent location. It is just a couple of blocks from Union Square, the Powell Street Cable Car, and Chinatown. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent rooms, excellent service, brilliant location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: We stayed for 5 nights and were very pleased with the Hotel Monaco. This was our 5th trip SF, and each time we've stayed at different hotels. This to me was the best by far, as well as one of the lowest priced. The room was really well decorated with great use of a small space (i.e. pocket door to the bathroom). I loved the wine reception with free back massages, as well as the complimentary starbucks coffee in the lobby every morning. Bring your own to go cup and fill up for the morning! The room featured L'occitaine bath products which worked really great with my highlighted hair. Most hotel shampoos are too stripping, but this one was moisturising with a nice fragrance. There is also complimentary starbucks in your room, but I saved mine:) The staff was really friendly too.

review.title: Totally Satisfied
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in a basic room (which we got a great deal on through Expedia). The hotel was great. Every staff member we met was helpful and friendly. The hotel was clean and quiet, but has no view. The free wine tasting every night was awesome, and the location ideal for shopping, and access to transit to get around and see the sites.

review.title: some what dissapointed with the location and clealiness of the hotel
review.reviewText: We visited SF for the first time this year and we were shocked how filthy and dirty the down town area was.... We recommend staying few blocks from the down town area to avoid the noise and many beggers and homeless around every corner.

review.title: Very fun and colorful hotel
review.reviewText: I really liked this hotel. They have the cutest canopy beds and everything is decorated in bright colors so you fill happy during your stay. The only think I didn't like was the price of room service. I ordered an orange juice and bowl of oatmeal. It came out to $29.82. I couldn't believe it! That was the ONLY thing I didn't like about the hotel. Otherwise, if you are looking for a convenient and comfortable place in Union Square...this is the best hotel around :)

review.title: Always a pleasure to stay at a Kimpton - Monaco being no exception. Love the class and style.
review.reviewText: Boutique hotels have a class and style all their own - and the staff treats with you with the utmost respect. Never a bad experience at one.

review.title: Can't always get what you want
review.reviewText: First, I booked this hotel because of the beautiful canopy bed pic's on the website. I made sure to pay the upgraded pricing to get a room like this to surprise my wife. When I got there my room not only did NOT have the canopy, but the room was extremely small. Only one spot to put the suitcase which blocked the front door. The room was well decorated, but again, not what the picture showed. When questioned, they said that "canopy" rooms don't always mean you get a canopy. Guess if I got a jacuzzi room, they means there may not be a jacuzzi in there, huh? Staff failed to replace dirty towels first night too. Staff was pleasant, (hard to tell if they are male or female, but we were in San Francisco). Lobby is beautiful with nice romantic seating area by fireplace. Just make sure you clarify what you are getting.

review.title: Excellent experience
review.reviewText: Despite the fact that the reservation for my room was lost upon arrival the staff did an excellent job at facilitating a resolution. Very professional and responsive. I will be staying here again on my next trip.

review.title: Hip & Attractive Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: I would definitely recommend the Hotel Monaco to anyone visiting San Fran! The place is hip & beautiful & the staff is very attentive, friendly & knowledgable. The restaurant is gorgeous & has excellent food. The spa is small, but nice & calming with many services available. The rooms are alsdo small, but that's to be expected in all boutique hotels. I will go back again! I loved my visit thanks to the Hotel Manaco.

review.title: Excellent Venue
review.reviewText: Very pleased with accomodations and the Grand Cafe restaurant....Staff was friendly and provided excellent service...Would stay again...

review.title: Would definitely stay here again ! ! ! ! ! !
review.reviewText: When we booked our trip to San Francisco, we chose the Hotel Monaco based on its 4 star rating and also reviews written by other people. We were not disappointed. The staff was very nice and helpful. It is within walking distance to many things. The room was the best part though. We had a queen canopy room. It was small, but apparently most rooms in downtown San Francisco are small. Extremely comfortable... decorated nicely... very cozy. Never a problem with hot water. Very nice bed!! A very pleasant experience ! And, don't miss the wine tasting at 5pm in the living room!

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: We were surprised with the overall service and feel of the Hotel Monaco and the location couldn't be better! Our only comment would be that the rooms are rather small and cramped.

review.title: Quaint
review.reviewText: more boutique than enormous style hotel. so know that before you choose to suit your preference.

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco last week. It was a great little hotel with a very friendly & helpful staff. The rooms are small but cozy. (We stayed in a queen deluxe type room)There is a really nice work out room downstairs with a hot tub & steam room. We would definitely stay here again!

review.title: One of the Best Boutique Hotels in SF
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is right in the vacinity of all major shopping and walking distance to most of the attractions in San Francisco. The hotel rooms are a bit small, but the attention to the detail in decor is phenomenal. Extremely friendly and helpful staff, especially concierge.

review.title: lovely
review.reviewText: wonderful cozy hotel

review.title: Best service!
review.reviewText: I'm a 20 year old, non-rich looking kid who stayed here for a weekend in August and the entire staff treated me perfectly. One time, someone asked me if everything was all right; I said the lamp under the canopy was broken...I came back from an errand 10 minutes later and it was fixed! Perfect service and always on their toes. I even splurged at the restaurant downstairs and had the friendliest service I've gotten during my entire stay. The hotel atmosphere was amazing, the rooms were small but I loved the bright decor and bathroom. Overall: I'd totally come back!

review.title: Loved the Grand Cafe -Food was exquisite
review.reviewText: Hotels service was great sometimes and and awful sometimes.

review.title: Friendliest staff ever!
review.reviewText: This was one of the loveliest hotels that we've ever stayed at. The room was VERY clean and well equipped. Check-in was fast and friendly. Restaurant downstairs was delish although a bit salty. Walking distance from best shopping. Our ONLY complaint is that the room could have been a bit bigger (Queen deluxe?) But would be perfect for 1 person. Best part about our room - the shower. Fantastic adjustable pressure showerhead. Bed and pillows were excellent/comfy.

review.title: Smooth, comfortable, charming
review.reviewText: The Monaco is a comfortable refuge in the heart of SF with a very friendly and helpful staff and everything you could need.

review.title: Terrific Staff in a Fun Setting
review.reviewText: I'll give the downside upfront: the rooms are small. Now the upside: The bathrooms are great size, L'occitane shampoos etc, bed was fantastic, they've done their best to make the rooms feel large using tasteful mirrors. We loved the good sound system including CD player in our room. Location was good for walking and public transportation. Staff was all friendly - made it feel like a boutique hotel. Nightly wine party was nice touch. Concierge was always available and helpful with directions and restaurants. And to top it all, they have fun with the Moroccan theme - canopy on the bed, things styled like steamer trunks, bell hops in purple corduroy suits...

review.title: excellent service; great location; small room
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel over a weekend business trip to san francisco. the hotel has excellent service and is laid out and designed in an interesting way as befits the kimpton boutique range. i have not stayed at other kimpton hotels in the city or elsewhere but this was a good experience and better in service terms than other similarly priced corporate / chain hotels. the room i stayed in was on the small side and, due to the layout of the hotel, dark. perhaps other rooms facing the street or facing back would have been better.

review.title: Just Fine
review.reviewText: This is a pleasant hotel with helpful staff and a very good restaurant. The decor in the rooms is a bit over the top and is not at all restful. The lighting in the rooms is also not conducive to being able to work for any length of time.

review.title: Great location and staff!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I just got back from a short stay at the Hotel Monaco in San Francisco!! The city is wonderful of course, but we truly lucked up in finding this great hotel. Being our first trip we were not aware of the proximity to shopping and sites. What a great location--The Hotel Monaco!!! The staff was eager to assist and always greeted you when you left and arrived back for the evening. Small but comfortable room. The cleanliness and terrific bedding more than made up for the lack of extra space. Will definitely stay again when back in San Francisco!!

review.title: The best hotel find in San Francisco
review.reviewText: While we were not overly impressed with San Francisco, this hotel was a true gem. It was our favorite part of the vacation. The aesthetics, cleanliness, friendliness and service were far beyond our expectations. Kudos, especially, to the concierge service. A must visit!

review.title: Would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: Staff always friendly and courteous. Complimentary cookies in the afternoon. Evening wine and cheese reception complimentary. Tarot card readings and chair massage with suggested donation available at reception. Great location a couple blocks from Union Square. Great restaurant and smaller bistro in the hotel. Spa and work out area too. This place is spotless and has beautiful common areas with fireplaces to relax or read in.

review.title: Great hotel...ridiculous parking
review.reviewText: The first room we got was pretty small...we couldn't walk around the bed because there was only 12" to the wall. We changed rooms and it was much better. The rooms were very clean and well appointed. The Grand Cafe restaurant was excellent. Valet parking was extremely expensive.

review.title: Favorite hotel in the world...
review.reviewText: I must say, this is my 3rd stay at the hotel over many years and the quality continually improves. The friendly staff who actual look like they enjoy helping you - cannot be overlooked. The coneirge continually helps you find restuarants, calls around for you, arranges everything you need. Based on teh staff size vs. number of guests it is very easy to get great service. The new spa is wonderful and relaxing. The free wine tasting at 5pm every day is of course a big plus. Overall I can't imagine a better location, a more confortable room (canopy bed for sure), or a more helpful staff. If ONLY they would fix (which they claim to be) the televisions so the remotes work correctly (they only work in a 2 feet area of the room) it would be perfect.

review.title: If I'm in San Francisco this is where I'm staying
review.reviewText: A beautiful hotel, they excedeed all my expectations. 10 out of 10.

review.title: I'd do it again
review.reviewText: This was my first stay at the Hotel Monaco. The staff was very professional and gracious. The room was lovely and there were no problems with room temperature or lack of hot water. I enjoyed every minute!

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: I'd never stayed at the Monaco before and I'm quite glad I did. The staff and service was excellent. The location was convienient and their friendly pet policy was an added bonus. All in all, excellent.

review.title: Funky luxury at its best!
review.reviewText: My husband and I have become loyal fans of Kimpton hotels, having stayed at several in various cities. The Hotel Monaco in SF is up there with their best -- beautifully designed and kept, and with an unbelievably warm & professional staff. The complimentary wine hour, morning coffee, fireplaces, goldfish (!) and the gorgeous spa are very cool touches. The room size is typical for an urban boutique hotel, so it's on the small side... but the Monaco itself is anything but typical. It was the best part of our stay in SF.

review.title: Comfy Surroundings - Will definitely stay again
review.reviewText: The Monaco has a complimentary wine service in their living room lounge - very cozy chairs and couches, a fireplace... great time to socialize with fellow travelers. The staff is polite and professional, although the concierge didn't acknowledge my presence until I interrupted her personal phone call with "Excuse me!" several times. Nevertheless, she did provide me w/ coupons on entry fees to local attractions/tours, etc. Be sure to book the airport shuttle through her - you'll save money over booking it yourself.

review.title: Great Place!
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and we had a wonderful time! The wine hour in the evening was great and the service was top notch! The location of the hotel was ideal for access to eat, shop etc. We will definitely stay there again when visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Great romantic get-away hotel!
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel for a romantic escapade. Rooms are small but the canopy queen bed is just so exotic that it makes up for it...just close those bed curtains and you are in a world of your own. Great service and great location. Fantastic restaurants everywhere!

review.title: good choice
review.reviewText: Excellent location,very friendly staff,parking was a little pricey but it seemed average for the locale.All in all a very pleasant experience.

review.title: Third time return guest
review.reviewText: This has been my third stay at The Hotel Monaco in San Francisco within the last 10 years. The hotel staff is superior. The hotel is in a great location and it's common areas are wonderful. The 5pm wine tastings are one of the highlights. I experienced a massage for the first time at Spa Equilibrium and it was outstanding. The rooms are very pretty and well maintained however, they are quite small. Having said that, you shouldn't be spending too much time in your room anyway, get out and see San Francisco.... I would recommend this hotel to all.

review.title: Excellent Amenities
review.reviewText: The room was small as we expected it to be from reviews of others, but the "living room" on the lobby floor provided us with comfortable sitting space to relax. The fitness center was equiped quite nicely. This was our first experience with a Kimpton Hotel and was very impressed with the service and amenities.

review.title: eclectic
review.reviewText: small but enjoyable rooms

review.title: Very impressed!
review.reviewText: I have stayed at many hotels in San Francisco and found the Monaco to be one of the very best. It was charming, efficient, friendly and had a warm, elegant style. Being a smaller boutique hotel it had a more personal feel than some of the larger hotels in Union Square - especially during the Holidays. The decor was lovely and unique. I will definitely stay there again!

review.title: The Monaco Hotel
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Monaco Hotel. The hotel staff was top notch, and the hotel was beautifully appointed. We will definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great Romantic getaway
review.reviewText: Perfect place to take that special love one. She will love the Queen Canopy Room. The hotel is close to everything. A perfect getaway...

review.title: Excellent small hotel
review.reviewText: This was our 2nd visit and again was excellent. Service is top notch.Rooms are small but well appointed.

review.title: Not impressed. Huge disappoinment
review.reviewText: It was a discount price for a discount room with less than par view and service. Rooms were smaller than expected. The only walkinng room we had was around the bed and we literally almsot would trip attemting that. The check in person was not personable. Our veiw was of the dumpsters and the smell was horrible.

review.title: Stylish and Comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel's theme and service made coming home after a long day's touring rewarding. We relaxed in the hot tub and steam room, which many hotels in San Fran lack, and took advantage of both the evening wine receptions and the morning coffee. This was our first trip in San Fran, and it was definitely a good call for "beginners" or travelers with family. We would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It's beautiful, immaculate and the service is wonderful. The people are all gracious and friendly. A Fabuous Stay!!!

review.title: Excellent choice
review.reviewText: An excellent location, close to Union Square. While the room was small, it was well equipped and clean. The staff was friendly, and they provide free Starbucks coffee in the morning as well as a nice wine reception in the evening. A consistently good choice in San Francisco. The free wireless internet throughout the property is a real plus for business travel.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: this is a nice boutique hotel w/in easy walking distance of union square. the rooms are small but nicely decorated. at the expedia rate, it was avery good value.

review.title: We would definitely go back to a Kimpton Hotel!
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly, the hotel was beautiful and nearby to great shopping and resturants.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: Great location and nicely decorated.

review.title: Will stay when i visit SF
review.reviewText: Wireless internet no charge, very attentive staff, very cool vibe in the place

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: I made reservations at this hotel during a suprise engagement trip for my girlfriend. When we got there, we were extremely impressed with the decore. The average room I got had to be one of the nicest rooms I have stayed in and the nicest room my girlfriend has stayed in. The bed was amazing and everything was so elegate. Would recommend the hotel in a heartbeat

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: We had a great time at Hotel Monaco! The staff was helpfull, the rooms were nice and clean, it is located next to Union Square, and the free Starbucks coffee (in the mornings) and wine (in the evening) is a classy touch. Also, our bed was very comfortable. My only very minor complaint is that I was not able to reach the concierge by phone one evening for a restaurant recommendation. Otherwise, we had a realy great stay at the Hotel Monaco. I recommend it highly.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Great location!!

review.title: Immaculate!!!  Friendly service, very clean, great location.
review.reviewText: I spent three nights with my fiancee and I was thouroughly impressed. I would not hesitate to return. The hotel is in a great location if you want to catch a show or do some shopping at Union Square. The concierge was very friendly and helpful. They reserved us a table at one of the best restaurants in Napa Valley, Auberge Du Soleil. For never having been in San Francisco, they made the stay very enjoyable. The hotel itself is very well decorated and the Grand Cafe is great for breakfast, the food is very good. Highly recomended hotel!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
The service was fantastic and the hotel is immaculate.
Great restaurant..

review.title: San Francisco's Best!
review.reviewText: This is not our first trip to Hotel Monaco.  We will continue to return.

review.title: One of the best parts of our trip, we could hardly leave the room it was so cozy and inviting!!
review.reviewText: Everything was awesome, the service, the decor was exactly as described.  Don't forget to ask for your goldfish, its fun to have a friend around while your out of town.  The wine reception is a must too!! The resturaunt is fabulous you don't evern have to leave the hotel for some of the best food in San Francisco!!
